4071         ue.ewma >>= UTIL_EST_WEIGHT_SHIFT;
4072 done:
4073         WRITE_ONCE(p->se.avg.util_est, ue);
4074 
4075         trace_sched_util_est_se_tp(&p->se);
4076 }
4077 
4078 static inline int task_fits_capacity(struct task_struct *p, long capacity)
     /*   */
4079 {
4080         return fits_capacity(uclamp_task_util(p), capacity);
4081 }
4082 
4083 static inline void update_misfit_status(struct task_struct *p, struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
4084 {
4085         bool need_update = true;
4086 
4087         trace_android_rvh_update_misfit_status(p, rq, &need_update);
4088         if (!static_branch_unlikely(&sched_asym_cpucapacity) || !need_update)
4089                 return;
4090 
4091         if (!p || p->nr_cpus_allowed == 1) {
4092                 rq->misfit_task_load = 0;
4093                 return;
4094         }
4095 
4096         if (task_fits_capacity(p, capacity_of(cpu_of(rq)))) {
4097                 rq->misfit_task_load = 0;
4098                 return;
4099         }
4100 
4101         /*
4102          * Make sure that misfit_task_load will not be null even if
4103          * task_h_load() returns 0.
4104          */
4105         rq->misfit_task_load = max_t(unsigned long, task_h_load(p), 1);
4106 }
4107 
4108 #else /* CONFIG_SMP */
4109 
4110 #define UPDATE_TG       0x0
4111 #define SKIP_AGE_LOAD   0x0
4112 #define DO_ATTACH       0x0
4113 
4114 static inline void update_load_avg(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *se, int not_used1)
     /*   */
4115 {
4116         cfs_rq_util_change(cfs_rq, 0);
4117 }
4118 
4119 static inline void remove_entity_load_avg(struct sched_entity *se) {}
     /*   */
4120 
4121 static inline void
4122 attach_entity_load_avg(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *se) {}
     /*   */
4123 static inline void
4124 detach_entity_load_avg(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *se) {}
     /*   */
4125 
4126 static inline int newidle_balance(struct rq *rq, struct rq_flags *rf)
     /*   */
4127 {
4128         return 0;
4129 }
4130 
4131 static inline void
4132 util_est_enqueue(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct task_struct *p) {}
     /*   */
4133 
4134 static inline void
4135 util_est_dequeue(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct task_struct *p) {}
     /*   */
4136 
4137 static inline void
4138 util_est_update(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct task_struct *p,
     /*   */
4139                 bool task_sleep) {}
4140 static inline void update_misfit_status(struct task_struct *p, struct rq *rq) {}
     /*   */
4141 
4142 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
4143 
4144 static void check_spread(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *se)
     /*   */
4145 {
4146 #ifdef CONFIG_SCHED_DEBUG
4147         s64 d = se->vruntime - cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
4148 
4149         if (d < 0)
4150                 d = -d;
4151 
4152         if (d > 3*sysctl_sched_latency)
4153                 schedstat_inc(cfs_rq->nr_spread_over);
4154 #endif
4155 }
4156 
4157 static void
4158 place_entity(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *se, int initial)
     /*   */
4159 {
4160         u64 vruntime = cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
4161 
4162         /*
4163          * The 'current' period is already promised to the current tasks,
4164          * however the extra weight of the new task will slow them down a
4165          * little, place the new task so that it fits in the slot that
4166          * stays open at the end.
4167          */
4168         if (initial && sched_feat(START_DEBIT))
4169                 vruntime += sched_vslice(cfs_rq, se);
4170 
4171         /* sleeps up to a single latency don't count. */
4172         if (!initial) {
4173                 unsigned long thresh = sysctl_sched_latency;
4174 
4175                 /*
4176                  * Halve their sleep time's effect, to allow
4177                  * for a gentler effect of sleepers:
4178                  */
4179                 if (sched_feat(GENTLE_FAIR_SLEEPERS))
4180                         thresh >>= 1;
4181 
4182                 vruntime -= thresh;
4183         }
4184 
4185         /* ensure we never gain time by being placed backwards. */
4186         se->vruntime = max_vruntime(se->vruntime, vruntime);
4187         trace_android_rvh_place_entity(cfs_rq, se, initial, vruntime);
4188 }
4189 
4190 static void check_enqueue_throttle(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq);
4191 
4192 static inline void check_schedstat_required(void)
     /*   */
4193 {
4194 #ifdef CONFIG_SCHEDSTATS
4195         if (schedstat_enabled())
4196                 return;
4197 
4198         /* Force schedstat enabled if a dependent tracepoint is active */
4199         if (trace_sched_stat_wait_enabled()    ||
4200                         trace_sched_stat_sleep_enabled()   ||
4201                         trace_sched_stat_iowait_enabled()  ||
4202                         trace_sched_stat_blocked_enabled() ||
4203                         trace_sched_stat_runtime_enabled())  {
4204                 printk_deferred_once("Scheduler tracepoints stat_sleep, stat_iowait, "
4205                              "stat_blocked and stat_runtime require the "
4206                              "kernel parameter schedstats=enable or "
4207                              "kernel.sched_schedstats=1\n");
4208         }
4209 #endif
4210 }
4211 
4212 static inline bool cfs_bandwidth_used(void);
4213 
4214 /*
4215  * MIGRATION
4216  *
4217  *      dequeue
4218  *        update_curr()
4219  *          update_min_vruntime()
4220  *        vruntime -= min_vruntime
4221  *
4222  *      enqueue
4223  *        update_curr()
4224  *          update_min_vruntime()
4225  *        vruntime += min_vruntime
4226  *
4227  * this way the vruntime transition between RQs is done when both
4228  * min_vruntime are up-to-date.
4229  *
4230  * WAKEUP (remote)
4231  *
4232  *      ->migrate_task_rq_fair() (p->state == TASK_WAKING)
4233  *        vruntime -= min_vruntime
4234  *
4235  *      enqueue
4236  *        update_curr()
4237  *          update_min_vruntime()
4238  *        vruntime += min_vruntime
4239  *
4240  * this way we don't have the most up-to-date min_vruntime on the originating
4241  * CPU and an up-to-date min_vruntime on the destination CPU.
4242  */
4243 
4244 static void
4245 enqueue_entity(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *se, int flags)
     /*   */
4246 {
4247         bool renorm = !(flags & ENQUEUE_WAKEUP) || (flags & ENQUEUE_MIGRATED);
4248         bool curr = cfs_rq->curr == se;
4249 
4250         /*
4251          * If we're the current task, we must renormalise before calling
4252          * update_curr().
4253          */
4254         if (renorm && curr)
4255                 se->vruntime += cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
4256 
4257         update_curr(cfs_rq);
4258 
4259         /*
4260          * Otherwise, renormalise after, such that we're placed at the current
4261          * moment in time, instead of some random moment in the past. Being
4262          * placed in the past could significantly boost this task to the
4263          * fairness detriment of existing tasks.
4264          */
4265         if (renorm && !curr)
4266                 se->vruntime += cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
4267 
4268         /*
4269          * When enqueuing a sched_entity, we must:
4270          *   - Update loads to have both entity and cfs_rq synced with now.
4271          *   - Add its load to cfs_rq->runnable_avg
4272          *   - For group_entity, update its weight to reflect the new share of
4273          *     its group cfs_rq
4274          *   - Add its new weight to cfs_rq->load.weight
4275          */
4276         update_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, UPDATE_TG | DO_ATTACH);
4277         se_update_runnable(se);
4278         update_cfs_group(se);
4279         account_entity_enqueue(cfs_rq, se);
4280 
4281         if (flags & ENQUEUE_WAKEUP)
4282                 place_entity(cfs_rq, se, 0);
4283 
4284         check_schedstat_required();
4285         update_stats_enqueue(cfs_rq, se, flags);
4286         check_spread(cfs_rq, se);
4287         if (!curr)
4288                 __enqueue_entity(cfs_rq, se);
4289         se->on_rq = 1;
4290 
4291         /*
4292          * When bandwidth control is enabled, cfs might have been removed
4293          * because of a parent been throttled but cfs->nr_running > 1. Try to
4294          * add it unconditionnally.
4295          */
4296         if (cfs_rq->nr_running == 1 || cfs_bandwidth_used())
4297                 list_add_leaf_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
4298 
4299         if (cfs_rq->nr_running == 1)
4300                 check_enqueue_throttle(cfs_rq);
4301 }
4302 
4303 static void __clear_buddies_last(struct sched_entity *se)
     /*   */
4304 {
4305         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
4306                 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
4307                 if (cfs_rq->last != se)
4308                         break;
4309 
4310                 cfs_rq->last = NULL;
4311         }
4312 }
4313 
4314 static void __clear_buddies_next(struct sched_entity *se)
     /*   */
4315 {
4316         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
4317                 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
4318                 if (cfs_rq->next != se)
4319                         break;
4320 
4321                 cfs_rq->next = NULL;
4322         }
4323 }
4324 
4325 static void __clear_buddies_skip(struct sched_entity *se)
     /*   */
4326 {
4327         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
4328                 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
4329                 if (cfs_rq->skip != se)
4330                         break;
4331 
4332                 cfs_rq->skip = NULL;
4333         }
4334 }
4335 
4336 static void clear_buddies(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *se)
     /*   */
4337 {
4338         if (cfs_rq->last == se)
4339                 __clear_buddies_last(se);
4340 
4341         if (cfs_rq->next == se)
4342                 __clear_buddies_next(se);
4343 
4344         if (cfs_rq->skip == se)
4345                 __clear_buddies_skip(se);
4346 }
4347 
4348 static __always_inline void return_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq);
4349 
4350 static void
4351 dequeue_entity(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *se, int flags)
     /*   */
4352 {
4353         /*
4354          * Update run-time statistics of the 'current'.
4355          */
4356         update_curr(cfs_rq);
4357 
4358         /*
4359          * When dequeuing a sched_entity, we must:
4360          *   - Update loads to have both entity and cfs_rq synced with now.
4361          *   - Subtract its load from the cfs_rq->runnable_avg.
4362          *   - Subtract its previous weight from cfs_rq->load.weight.
4363          *   - For group entity, update its weight to reflect the new share
4364          *     of its group cfs_rq.
4365          */
4366         update_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, UPDATE_TG);
4367         se_update_runnable(se);
4368 
4369         update_stats_dequeue(cfs_rq, se, flags);
4370 
4371         clear_buddies(cfs_rq, se);
4372 
4373         if (se != cfs_rq->curr)
4374                 __dequeue_entity(cfs_rq, se);
4375         se->on_rq = 0;
4376         account_entity_dequeue(cfs_rq, se);
4377 
4378         /*
4379          * Normalize after update_curr(); which will also have moved
4380          * min_vruntime if @se is the one holding it back. But before doing
4381          * update_min_vruntime() again, which will discount @se's position and
4382          * can move min_vruntime forward still more.
4383          */
4384         if (!(flags & DEQUEUE_SLEEP))
4385                 se->vruntime -= cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
4386 
4387         /* return excess runtime on last dequeue */
4388         return_cfs_rq_runtime(cfs_rq);
4389 
4390         update_cfs_group(se);
4391 
4392         /*
4393          * Now advance min_vruntime if @se was the entity holding it back,
4394          * except when: DEQUEUE_SAVE && !DEQUEUE_MOVE, in this case we'll be
4395          * put back on, and if we advance min_vruntime, we'll be placed back
4396          * further than we started -- ie. we'll be penalized.
4397          */
4398         if ((flags & (DEQUEUE_SAVE | DEQUEUE_MOVE)) != DEQUEUE_SAVE)
4399                 update_min_vruntime(cfs_rq);
4400 }
4401 
4402 /*
4403  * Preempt the current task with a newly woken task if needed:
4404  */
4405 static void
4406 check_preempt_tick(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *curr)
     /*   */
4407 {
4408         unsigned long ideal_runtime, delta_exec;
4409         struct sched_entity *se;
4410         s64 delta;
4411         bool skip_preempt = false;
4412 
4413         ideal_runtime = sched_slice(cfs_rq, curr);
4414         delta_exec = curr->sum_exec_runtime - curr->prev_sum_exec_runtime;
4415         trace_android_rvh_check_preempt_tick(current, &ideal_runtime, &skip_preempt,
4416                         delta_exec, cfs_rq, curr, sysctl_sched_min_granularity);
4417         if (skip_preempt)
4418                 return;
4419         if (delta_exec > ideal_runtime) {
4420                 resched_curr(rq_of(cfs_rq));
4421                 /*
4422                  * The current task ran long enough, ensure it doesn't get
4423                  * re-elected due to buddy favours.
4424                  */
4425                 clear_buddies(cfs_rq, curr);
4426                 return;
4427         }
4428 
4429         /*
4430          * Ensure that a task that missed wakeup preemption by a
4431          * narrow margin doesn't have to wait for a full slice.
4432          * This also mitigates buddy induced latencies under load.
4433          */
4434         if (delta_exec < sysctl_sched_min_granularity)
4435                 return;
4436 
4437         se = __pick_first_entity(cfs_rq);
4438         delta = curr->vruntime - se->vruntime;
4439 
4440         if (delta < 0)
4441                 return;
4442 
4443         if (delta > ideal_runtime)
4444                 resched_curr(rq_of(cfs_rq));
4445 }
4446 
4447 void set_next_entity(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *se)
     /*   */
4448 {
4449         /* 'current' is not kept within the tree. */
4450         if (se->on_rq) {
4451                 /*
4452                  * Any task has to be enqueued before it get to execute on
4453                  * a CPU. So account for the time it spent waiting on the
4454                  * runqueue.
4455                  */
4456                 update_stats_wait_end(cfs_rq, se);
4457                 __dequeue_entity(cfs_rq, se);
4458                 update_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, UPDATE_TG);
4459         }
4460 
4461         update_stats_curr_start(cfs_rq, se);
4462         cfs_rq->curr = se;
4463 
4464         /*
4465          * Track our maximum slice length, if the CPU's load is at
4466          * least twice that of our own weight (i.e. dont track it
4467          * when there are only lesser-weight tasks around):
4468          */
4469         if (schedstat_enabled() &&
4470             rq_of(cfs_rq)->cfs.load.weight >= 2*se->load.weight) {
4471                 schedstat_set(se->statistics.slice_max,
4472                         max((u64)schedstat_val(se->statistics.slice_max),
4473                             se->sum_exec_runtime - se->prev_sum_exec_runtime));
4474         }
4475 
4476         se->prev_sum_exec_runtime = se->sum_exec_runtime;
4477 }
4478 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(set_next_entity);
4479 
4480 
4481 static int
4482 wakeup_preempt_entity(struct sched_entity *curr, struct sched_entity *se);
4483 
4484 /*
4485  * Pick the next process, keeping these things in mind, in this order:
4486  * 1) keep things fair between processes/task groups
4487  * 2) pick the "next" process, since someone really wants that to run
4488  * 3) pick the "last" process, for cache locality
4489  * 4) do not run the "skip" process, if something else is available
4490  */
4491 static struct sched_entity *
4492 pick_next_entity(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *curr)
     /*   */
4493 {
4494         struct sched_entity *left = __pick_first_entity(cfs_rq);
4495         struct sched_entity *se = NULL;
4496 
4497         trace_android_rvh_pick_next_entity(cfs_rq, curr, &se);
4498         if (se)
4499                 goto done;
4500 
4501         /*
4502          * If curr is set we have to see if its left of the leftmost entity
4503          * still in the tree, provided there was anything in the tree at all.
4504          */
4505         if (!left || (curr && entity_before(curr, left)))
4506                 left = curr;
4507 
4508         se = left; /* ideally we run the leftmost entity */
4509 
4510         /*
4511          * Avoid running the skip buddy, if running something else can
4512          * be done without getting too unfair.
4513          */
4514         if (cfs_rq->skip == se) {
4515                 struct sched_entity *second;
4516 
4517                 if (se == curr) {
4518                         second = __pick_first_entity(cfs_rq);
4519                 } else {
4520                         second = __pick_next_entity(se);
4521                         if (!second || (curr && entity_before(curr, second)))
4522                                 second = curr;
4523                 }
4524 
4525                 if (second && wakeup_preempt_entity(second, left) < 1)
4526                         se = second;
4527         }
4528 
4529         if (cfs_rq->next && wakeup_preempt_entity(cfs_rq->next, left) < 1) {
4530                 /*
4531                  * Someone really wants this to run. If it's not unfair, run it.
4532                  */
4533                 se = cfs_rq->next;
4534         } else if (cfs_rq->last && wakeup_preempt_entity(cfs_rq->last, left) < 1) {
4535                 /*
4536                  * Prefer last buddy, try to return the CPU to a preempted task.
4537                  */
4538                 se = cfs_rq->last;
4539         }
4540 
4541 done:
4542         clear_buddies(cfs_rq, se);
4543 
4544         return se;
4545 }
4546 
4547 static bool check_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq);
4548 
4549 static void put_prev_entity(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *prev)
     /*   */
4550 {
4551         /*
4552          * If still on the runqueue then deactivate_task()
4553          * was not called and update_curr() has to be done:
4554          */
4555         if (prev->on_rq)
4556                 update_curr(cfs_rq);
4557 
4558         /* throttle cfs_rqs exceeding runtime */
4559         check_cfs_rq_runtime(cfs_rq);
4560 
4561         check_spread(cfs_rq, prev);
4562 
4563         if (prev->on_rq) {
4564                 update_stats_wait_start(cfs_rq, prev);
4565                 /* Put 'current' back into the tree. */
4566                 __enqueue_entity(cfs_rq, prev);
4567                 /* in !on_rq case, update occurred at dequeue */
4568                 update_load_avg(cfs_rq, prev, 0);
4569         }
4570         cfs_rq->curr = NULL;
4571 }
4572 
4573 static void
4574 entity_tick(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, struct sched_entity *curr, int queued)
     /*   */
4575 {
4576         /*
4577          * Update run-time statistics of the 'current'.
4578          */
4579         update_curr(cfs_rq);
4580 
4581         /*
4582          * Ensure that runnable average is periodically updated.
4583          */
4584         update_load_avg(cfs_rq, curr, UPDATE_TG);
4585         update_cfs_group(curr);
4586 
4587 #ifdef CONFIG_SCHED_HRTICK
4588         /*
4589          * queued ticks are scheduled to match the slice, so don't bother
4590          * validating it and just reschedule.
4591          */
4592         if (queued) {
4593                 resched_curr(rq_of(cfs_rq));
4594                 return;
4595         }
4596         /*
4597          * don't let the period tick interfere with the hrtick preemption
4598          */
4599         if (!sched_feat(DOUBLE_TICK) &&
4600                         hrtimer_active(&rq_of(cfs_rq)->hrtick_timer))
4601                 return;
4602 #endif
4603 
4604         if (cfs_rq->nr_running > 1)
4605                 check_preempt_tick(cfs_rq, curr);
4606         trace_android_rvh_entity_tick(cfs_rq, curr);
4607 }
4608 
4609 
4610 /**************************************************
4611  * CFS bandwidth control machinery
4612  */
4613 
4614 #ifdef CONFIG_CFS_BANDWIDTH
4615 
4616 #ifdef CONFIG_JUMP_LABEL
4617 static struct static_key __cfs_bandwidth_used;
4618 
4619 static inline bool cfs_bandwidth_used(void)
     /*   */
4620 {
4621         return static_key_false(&__cfs_bandwidth_used);
4622 }
4623 
4624 void cfs_bandwidth_usage_inc(void)
     /*   */
4625 {
4626         static_key_slow_inc_cpuslocked(&__cfs_bandwidth_used);
4627 }
4628 
4629 void cfs_bandwidth_usage_dec(void)
     /*   */
4630 {
4631         static_key_slow_dec_cpuslocked(&__cfs_bandwidth_used);
4632 }
4633 #else /* CONFIG_JUMP_LABEL */
4634 static bool cfs_bandwidth_used(void)
     /*   */
4635 {
4636         return true;
4637 }
4638 
4639 void cfs_bandwidth_usage_inc(void) {}
     /*   */
4640 void cfs_bandwidth_usage_dec(void) {}
     /*   */
4641 #endif /* CONFIG_JUMP_LABEL */
4642 
4643 /*
4644  * default period for cfs group bandwidth.
4645  * default: 0.1s, units: nanoseconds
4646  */
4647 static inline u64 default_cfs_period(void)
     /*   */
4648 {
4649         return 100000000ULL;
4650 }
4651 
4652 static inline u64 sched_cfs_bandwidth_slice(void)
     /*   */
4653 {
4654         return (u64)sysctl_sched_cfs_bandwidth_slice * NSEC_PER_USEC;
4655 }
4656 
4657 /*
4658  * Replenish runtime according to assigned quota. We use sched_clock_cpu
4659  * directly instead of rq->clock to avoid adding additional synchronization
4660  * around rq->lock.
4661  *
4662  * requires cfs_b->lock
4663  */
4664 void __refill_cfs_bandwidth_runtime(struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b)
     /*   */
4665 {
4666         if (cfs_b->quota != RUNTIME_INF)
4667                 cfs_b->runtime = cfs_b->quota;
4668 }
4669 
4670 static inline struct cfs_bandwidth *tg_cfs_bandwidth(struct task_group *tg)
     /*   */
4671 {
4672         return &tg->cfs_bandwidth;
4673 }
4674 
4675 /* returns 0 on failure to allocate runtime */
4676 static int __assign_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b,
     /*   */
4677                                    struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, u64 target_runtime)
4678 {
4679         u64 min_amount, amount = 0;
4680 
4681         lockdep_assert_held(&cfs_b->lock);
4682 
4683         /* note: this is a positive sum as runtime_remaining <= 0 */
4684         min_amount = target_runtime - cfs_rq->runtime_remaining;
4685 
4686         if (cfs_b->quota == RUNTIME_INF)
4687                 amount = min_amount;
4688         else {
4689                 start_cfs_bandwidth(cfs_b);
4690 
4691                 if (cfs_b->runtime > 0) {
4692                         amount = min(cfs_b->runtime, min_amount);
4693                         cfs_b->runtime -= amount;
4694                         cfs_b->idle = 0;
4695                 }
4696         }
4697 
4698         cfs_rq->runtime_remaining += amount;
4699 
4700         return cfs_rq->runtime_remaining > 0;
4701 }
4702 
4703 /* returns 0 on failure to allocate runtime */
4704 static int assign_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
4705 {
4706         struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b = tg_cfs_bandwidth(cfs_rq->tg);
4707         int ret;
4708 
4709         raw_spin_lock(&cfs_b->lock);
4710         ret = __assign_cfs_rq_runtime(cfs_b, cfs_rq, sched_cfs_bandwidth_slice());
4711         raw_spin_unlock(&cfs_b->lock);
4712 
4713         return ret;
4714 }
4715 
4716 static void __account_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, u64 delta_exec)
     /*   */
4717 {
4718         /* dock delta_exec before expiring quota (as it could span periods) */
4719         cfs_rq->runtime_remaining -= delta_exec;
4720 
4721         if (likely(cfs_rq->runtime_remaining > 0))
4722                 return;
4723 
4724         if (cfs_rq->throttled)
4725                 return;
4726         /*
4727          * if we're unable to extend our runtime we resched so that the active
4728          * hierarchy can be throttled
4729          */
4730         if (!assign_cfs_rq_runtime(cfs_rq) && likely(cfs_rq->curr))
4731                 resched_curr(rq_of(cfs_rq));
4732 }
4733 
4734 static __always_inline
4735 void account_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, u64 delta_exec)
     /*   */
4736 {
4737         if (!cfs_bandwidth_used() || !cfs_rq->runtime_enabled)
4738                 return;
4739 
4740         __account_cfs_rq_runtime(cfs_rq, delta_exec);
4741 }
4742 
4743 static inline int cfs_rq_throttled(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
4744 {
4745         return cfs_bandwidth_used() && cfs_rq->throttled;
4746 }
4747 
4748 /* check whether cfs_rq, or any parent, is throttled */
4749 static inline int throttled_hierarchy(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
4750 {
4751         return cfs_bandwidth_used() && cfs_rq->throttle_count;
4752 }
4753 
4754 /*
4755  * Ensure that neither of the group entities corresponding to src_cpu or
4756  * dest_cpu are members of a throttled hierarchy when performing group
4757  * load-balance operations.
4758  */
4759 static inline int throttled_lb_pair(struct task_group *tg,
     /*   */
4760                                     int src_cpu, int dest_cpu)
4761 {
4762         struct cfs_rq *src_cfs_rq, *dest_cfs_rq;
4763 
4764         src_cfs_rq = tg->cfs_rq[src_cpu];
4765         dest_cfs_rq = tg->cfs_rq[dest_cpu];
4766 
4767         return throttled_hierarchy(src_cfs_rq) ||
4768                throttled_hierarchy(dest_cfs_rq);
4769 }
4770 
4771 static int tg_unthrottle_up(struct task_group *tg, void *data)
     /*   */
4772 {
4773         struct rq *rq = data;
4774         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = tg->cfs_rq[cpu_of(rq)];
4775 
4776         cfs_rq->throttle_count--;
4777         if (!cfs_rq->throttle_count) {
4778                 cfs_rq->throttled_clock_task_time += rq_clock_task(rq) -
4779                                              cfs_rq->throttled_clock_task;
4780 
4781                 /* Add cfs_rq with already running entity in the list */
4782                 if (cfs_rq->nr_running >= 1)
4783                         list_add_leaf_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
4784         }
4785 
4786         return 0;
4787 }
4788 
4789 static int tg_throttle_down(struct task_group *tg, void *data)
     /*   */
4790 {
4791         struct rq *rq = data;
4792         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = tg->cfs_rq[cpu_of(rq)];
4793 
4794         /* group is entering throttled state, stop time */
4795         if (!cfs_rq->throttle_count) {
4796                 cfs_rq->throttled_clock_task = rq_clock_task(rq);
4797                 list_del_leaf_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
4798         }
4799         cfs_rq->throttle_count++;
4800 
4801         return 0;
4802 }
4803 
4804 static bool throttle_cfs_rq(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
4805 {
4806         struct rq *rq = rq_of(cfs_rq);
4807         struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b = tg_cfs_bandwidth(cfs_rq->tg);
4808         struct sched_entity *se;
4809         long task_delta, idle_task_delta, dequeue = 1;
4810 
4811         raw_spin_lock(&cfs_b->lock);
4812         /* This will start the period timer if necessary */
4813         if (__assign_cfs_rq_runtime(cfs_b, cfs_rq, 1)) {
4814                 /*
4815                  * We have raced with bandwidth becoming available, and if we
4816                  * actually throttled the timer might not unthrottle us for an
4817                  * entire period. We additionally needed to make sure that any
4818                  * subsequent check_cfs_rq_runtime calls agree not to throttle
4819                  * us, as we may commit to do cfs put_prev+pick_next, so we ask
4820                  * for 1ns of runtime rather than just check cfs_b.
4821                  */
4822                 dequeue = 0;
4823         } else {
4824                 list_add_tail_rcu(&cfs_rq->throttled_list,
4825                                   &cfs_b->throttled_cfs_rq);
4826         }
4827         raw_spin_unlock(&cfs_b->lock);
4828 
4829         if (!dequeue)
4830                 return false;  /* Throttle no longer required. */
4831 
4832         se = cfs_rq->tg->se[cpu_of(rq_of(cfs_rq))];
4833 
4834         /* freeze hierarchy runnable averages while throttled */
4835         rcu_read_lock();
4836         walk_tg_tree_from(cfs_rq->tg, tg_throttle_down, tg_nop, (void *)rq);
4837         rcu_read_unlock();
4838 
4839         task_delta = cfs_rq->h_nr_running;
4840         idle_task_delta = cfs_rq->idle_h_nr_running;
4841         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
4842                 struct cfs_rq *qcfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
4843                 /* throttled entity or throttle-on-deactivate */
4844                 if (!se->on_rq)
4845                         break;
4846 
4847                 if (dequeue) {
4848                         dequeue_entity(qcfs_rq, se, DEQUEUE_SLEEP);
4849                 } else {
4850                         update_load_avg(qcfs_rq, se, 0);
4851                         se_update_runnable(se);
4852                 }
4853 
4854                 qcfs_rq->h_nr_running -= task_delta;
4855                 qcfs_rq->idle_h_nr_running -= idle_task_delta;
4856 
4857                 if (qcfs_rq->load.weight)
4858                         dequeue = 0;
4859         }
4860 
4861         if (!se)
4862                 sub_nr_running(rq, task_delta);
4863 
4864         /*
4865          * Note: distribution will already see us throttled via the
4866          * throttled-list.  rq->lock protects completion.
4867          */
4868         cfs_rq->throttled = 1;
4869         cfs_rq->throttled_clock = rq_clock(rq);
4870         return true;
4871 }
4872 
4873 void unthrottle_cfs_rq(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
4874 {
4875         struct rq *rq = rq_of(cfs_rq);
4876         struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b = tg_cfs_bandwidth(cfs_rq->tg);
4877         struct sched_entity *se;
4878         long task_delta, idle_task_delta;
4879 
4880         se = cfs_rq->tg->se[cpu_of(rq)];
4881 
4882         cfs_rq->throttled = 0;
4883 
4884         update_rq_clock(rq);
4885 
4886         raw_spin_lock(&cfs_b->lock);
4887         cfs_b->throttled_time += rq_clock(rq) - cfs_rq->throttled_clock;
4888         list_del_rcu(&cfs_rq->throttled_list);
4889         raw_spin_unlock(&cfs_b->lock);
4890 
4891         /* update hierarchical throttle state */
4892         walk_tg_tree_from(cfs_rq->tg, tg_nop, tg_unthrottle_up, (void *)rq);
4893 
4894         if (!cfs_rq->load.weight)
4895                 return;
4896 
4897         task_delta = cfs_rq->h_nr_running;
4898         idle_task_delta = cfs_rq->idle_h_nr_running;
4899         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
4900                 if (se->on_rq)
4901                         break;
4902                 cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
4903                 enqueue_entity(cfs_rq, se, ENQUEUE_WAKEUP);
4904 
4905                 cfs_rq->h_nr_running += task_delta;
4906                 cfs_rq->idle_h_nr_running += idle_task_delta;
4907 
4908                 /* end evaluation on encountering a throttled cfs_rq */
4909                 if (cfs_rq_throttled(cfs_rq))
4910                         goto unthrottle_throttle;
4911         }
4912 
4913         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
4914                 cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
4915 
4916                 update_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, UPDATE_TG);
4917                 se_update_runnable(se);
4918 
4919                 cfs_rq->h_nr_running += task_delta;
4920                 cfs_rq->idle_h_nr_running += idle_task_delta;
4921 
4922 
4923                 /* end evaluation on encountering a throttled cfs_rq */
4924                 if (cfs_rq_throttled(cfs_rq))
4925                         goto unthrottle_throttle;
4926 
4927                 /*
4928                  * One parent has been throttled and cfs_rq removed from the
4929                  * list. Add it back to not break the leaf list.
4930                  */
4931                 if (throttled_hierarchy(cfs_rq))
4932                         list_add_leaf_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
4933         }
4934 
4935         /* At this point se is NULL and we are at root level*/
4936         add_nr_running(rq, task_delta);
4937 
4938 unthrottle_throttle:
4939         /*
4940          * The cfs_rq_throttled() breaks in the above iteration can result in
4941          * incomplete leaf list maintenance, resulting in triggering the
4942          * assertion below.
4943          */
4944         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
4945                 cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
4946 
4947                 if (list_add_leaf_cfs_rq(cfs_rq))
4948                         break;
4949         }
4950 
4951         assert_list_leaf_cfs_rq(rq);
4952 
4953         /* Determine whether we need to wake up potentially idle CPU: */
4954         if (rq->curr == rq->idle && rq->cfs.nr_running)
4955                 resched_curr(rq);
4956 }
4957 
4958 static void distribute_cfs_runtime(struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b)
     /*   */
4959 {
4960         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
4961         u64 runtime, remaining = 1;
4962 
4963         rcu_read_lock();
4964         list_for_each_entry_rcu(cfs_rq, &cfs_b->throttled_cfs_rq,
4965                                 throttled_list) {
4966                 struct rq *rq = rq_of(cfs_rq);
4967                 struct rq_flags rf;
4968 
4969                 rq_lock_irqsave(rq, &rf);
4970                 if (!cfs_rq_throttled(cfs_rq))
4971                         goto next;
4972 
4973                 /* By the above check, this should never be true */
4974                 SCHED_WARN_ON(cfs_rq->runtime_remaining > 0);
4975 
4976                 raw_spin_lock(&cfs_b->lock);
4977                 runtime = -cfs_rq->runtime_remaining + 1;
4978                 if (runtime > cfs_b->runtime)
4979                         runtime = cfs_b->runtime;
4980                 cfs_b->runtime -= runtime;
4981                 remaining = cfs_b->runtime;
4982                 raw_spin_unlock(&cfs_b->lock);
4983 
4984                 cfs_rq->runtime_remaining += runtime;
4985 
4986                 /* we check whether we're throttled above */
4987                 if (cfs_rq->runtime_remaining > 0)
4988                         unthrottle_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
4989 
4990 next:
4991                 rq_unlock_irqrestore(rq, &rf);
4992 
4993                 if (!remaining)
4994                         break;
4995         }
4996         rcu_read_unlock();
4997 }
4998 
4999 /*
5000  * Responsible for refilling a task_group's bandwidth and unthrottling its
5001  * cfs_rqs as appropriate. If there has been no activity within the last
5002  * period the timer is deactivated until scheduling resumes; cfs_b->idle is
5003  * used to track this state.
5004  */
5005 static int do_sched_cfs_period_timer(struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b, int overrun, unsigned long flags)
     /*   */
5006 {
5007         int throttled;
5008 
5009         /* no need to continue the timer with no bandwidth constraint */
5010         if (cfs_b->quota == RUNTIME_INF)
5011                 goto out_deactivate;
5012 
5013         throttled = !list_empty(&cfs_b->throttled_cfs_rq);
5014         cfs_b->nr_periods += overrun;
5015 
5016         /*
5017          * idle depends on !throttled (for the case of a large deficit), and if
5018          * we're going inactive then everything else can be deferred
5019          */
5020         if (cfs_b->idle && !throttled)
5021                 goto out_deactivate;
5022 
5023         __refill_cfs_bandwidth_runtime(cfs_b);
5024 
5025         if (!throttled) {
5026                 /* mark as potentially idle for the upcoming period */
5027                 cfs_b->idle = 1;
5028                 return 0;
5029         }
5030 
5031         /* account preceding periods in which throttling occurred */
5032         cfs_b->nr_throttled += overrun;
5033 
5034         /*
5035          * This check is repeated as we release cfs_b->lock while we unthrottle.
5036          */
5037         while (throttled && cfs_b->runtime > 0) {
5038                 raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&cfs_b->lock, flags);
5039                 /* we can't nest cfs_b->lock while distributing bandwidth */
5040                 distribute_cfs_runtime(cfs_b);
5041                 raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&cfs_b->lock, flags);
5042 
5043                 throttled = !list_empty(&cfs_b->throttled_cfs_rq);
5044         }
5045 
5046         /*
5047          * While we are ensured activity in the period following an
5048          * unthrottle, this also covers the case in which the new bandwidth is
5049          * insufficient to cover the existing bandwidth deficit.  (Forcing the
5050          * timer to remain active while there are any throttled entities.)
5051          */
5052         cfs_b->idle = 0;
5053 
5054         return 0;
5055 
5056 out_deactivate:
5057         return 1;
5058 }
5059 
5060 /* a cfs_rq won't donate quota below this amount */
5061 static const u64 min_cfs_rq_runtime = 1 * NSEC_PER_MSEC;
5062 /* minimum remaining period time to redistribute slack quota */
5063 static const u64 min_bandwidth_expiration = 2 * NSEC_PER_MSEC;
5064 /* how long we wait to gather additional slack before distributing */
5065 static const u64 cfs_bandwidth_slack_period = 5 * NSEC_PER_MSEC;
5066 
5067 /*
5068  * Are we near the end of the current quota period?
5069  *
5070  * Requires cfs_b->lock for hrtimer_expires_remaining to be safe against the
5071  * hrtimer base being cleared by hrtimer_start. In the case of
5072  * migrate_hrtimers, base is never cleared, so we are fine.
5073  */
5074 static int runtime_refresh_within(struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b, u64 min_expire)
     /*   */
5075 {
5076         struct hrtimer *refresh_timer = &cfs_b->period_timer;
5077         u64 remaining;
5078 
5079         /* if the call-back is running a quota refresh is already occurring */
5080         if (hrtimer_callback_running(refresh_timer))
5081                 return 1;
5082 
5083         /* is a quota refresh about to occur? */
5084         remaining = ktime_to_ns(hrtimer_expires_remaining(refresh_timer));
5085         if (remaining < min_expire)
5086                 return 1;
5087 
5088         return 0;
5089 }
5090 
5091 static void start_cfs_slack_bandwidth(struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b)
     /*   */
5092 {
5093         u64 min_left = cfs_bandwidth_slack_period + min_bandwidth_expiration;
5094 
5095         /* if there's a quota refresh soon don't bother with slack */
5096         if (runtime_refresh_within(cfs_b, min_left))
5097                 return;
5098 
5099         /* don't push forwards an existing deferred unthrottle */
5100         if (cfs_b->slack_started)
5101                 return;
5102         cfs_b->slack_started = true;
5103 
5104         hrtimer_start(&cfs_b->slack_timer,
5105                         ns_to_ktime(cfs_bandwidth_slack_period),
5106                         HRTIMER_MODE_REL);
5107 }
5108 
5109 /* we know any runtime found here is valid as update_curr() precedes return */
5110 static void __return_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
5111 {
5112         struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b = tg_cfs_bandwidth(cfs_rq->tg);
5113         s64 slack_runtime = cfs_rq->runtime_remaining - min_cfs_rq_runtime;
5114 
5115         if (slack_runtime <= 0)
5116                 return;
5117 
5118         raw_spin_lock(&cfs_b->lock);
5119         if (cfs_b->quota != RUNTIME_INF) {
5120                 cfs_b->runtime += slack_runtime;
5121 
5122                 /* we are under rq->lock, defer unthrottling using a timer */
5123                 if (cfs_b->runtime > sched_cfs_bandwidth_slice() &&
5124                     !list_empty(&cfs_b->throttled_cfs_rq))
5125                         start_cfs_slack_bandwidth(cfs_b);
5126         }
5127         raw_spin_unlock(&cfs_b->lock);
5128 
5129         /* even if it's not valid for return we don't want to try again */
5130         cfs_rq->runtime_remaining -= slack_runtime;
5131 }
5132 
5133 static __always_inline void return_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
5134 {
5135         if (!cfs_bandwidth_used())
5136                 return;
5137 
5138         if (!cfs_rq->runtime_enabled || cfs_rq->nr_running)
5139                 return;
5140 
5141         __return_cfs_rq_runtime(cfs_rq);
5142 }
5143 
5144 /*
5145  * This is done with a timer (instead of inline with bandwidth return) since
5146  * it's necessary to juggle rq->locks to unthrottle their respective cfs_rqs.
5147  */
5148 static void do_sched_cfs_slack_timer(struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b)
     /*   */
5149 {
5150         u64 runtime = 0, slice = sched_cfs_bandwidth_slice();
5151         unsigned long flags;
5152 
5153         /* confirm we're still not at a refresh boundary */
5154         raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&cfs_b->lock, flags);
5155         cfs_b->slack_started = false;
5156 
5157         if (runtime_refresh_within(cfs_b, min_bandwidth_expiration)) {
5158                 raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&cfs_b->lock, flags);
5159                 return;
5160         }
5161 
5162         if (cfs_b->quota != RUNTIME_INF && cfs_b->runtime > slice)
5163                 runtime = cfs_b->runtime;
5164 
5165         raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&cfs_b->lock, flags);
5166 
5167         if (!runtime)
5168                 return;
5169 
5170         distribute_cfs_runtime(cfs_b);
5171 
5172         raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&cfs_b->lock, flags);
5173         raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&cfs_b->lock, flags);
5174 }
5175 
5176 /*
5177  * When a group wakes up we want to make sure that its quota is not already
5178  * expired/exceeded, otherwise it may be allowed to steal additional ticks of
5179  * runtime as update_curr() throttling can not not trigger until it's on-rq.
5180  */
5181 static void check_enqueue_throttle(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
5182 {
5183         if (!cfs_bandwidth_used())
5184                 return;
5185 
5186         /* an active group must be handled by the update_curr()->put() path */
5187         if (!cfs_rq->runtime_enabled || cfs_rq->curr)
5188                 return;
5189 
5190         /* ensure the group is not already throttled */
5191         if (cfs_rq_throttled(cfs_rq))
5192                 return;
5193 
5194         /* update runtime allocation */
5195         account_cfs_rq_runtime(cfs_rq, 0);
5196         if (cfs_rq->runtime_remaining <= 0)
5197                 throttle_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
5198 }
5199 
5200 static void sync_throttle(struct task_group *tg, int cpu)
     /*   */
5201 {
5202         struct cfs_rq *pcfs_rq, *cfs_rq;
5203 
5204         if (!cfs_bandwidth_used())
5205                 return;
5206 
5207         if (!tg->parent)
5208                 return;
5209 
5210         cfs_rq = tg->cfs_rq[cpu];
5211         pcfs_rq = tg->parent->cfs_rq[cpu];
5212 
5213         cfs_rq->throttle_count = pcfs_rq->throttle_count;
5214         cfs_rq->throttled_clock_task = rq_clock_task(cpu_rq(cpu));
5215 }
5216 
5217 /* conditionally throttle active cfs_rq's from put_prev_entity() */
5218 static bool check_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
5219 {
5220         if (!cfs_bandwidth_used())
5221                 return false;
5222 
5223         if (likely(!cfs_rq->runtime_enabled || cfs_rq->runtime_remaining > 0))
5224                 return false;
5225 
5226         /*
5227          * it's possible for a throttled entity to be forced into a running
5228          * state (e.g. set_curr_task), in this case we're finished.
5229          */
5230         if (cfs_rq_throttled(cfs_rq))
5231                 return true;
5232 
5233         return throttle_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
5234 }
5235 
5236 static enum hrtimer_restart sched_cfs_slack_timer(struct hrtimer *timer)
     /*   */
5237 {
5238         struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b =
5239                 container_of(timer, struct cfs_bandwidth, slack_timer);
5240 
5241         do_sched_cfs_slack_timer(cfs_b);
5242 
5243         return HRTIMER_NORESTART;
5244 }
5245 
5246 extern const u64 max_cfs_quota_period;
5247 
5248 static enum hrtimer_restart sched_cfs_period_timer(struct hrtimer *timer)
     /*   */
5249 {
5250         struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b =
5251                 container_of(timer, struct cfs_bandwidth, period_timer);
5252         unsigned long flags;
5253         int overrun;
5254         int idle = 0;
5255         int count = 0;
5256 
5257         raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&cfs_b->lock, flags);
5258         for (;;) {
5259                 overrun = hrtimer_forward_now(timer, cfs_b->period);
5260                 if (!overrun)
5261                         break;
5262 
5263                 idle = do_sched_cfs_period_timer(cfs_b, overrun, flags);
5264 
5265                 if (++count > 3) {
5266                         u64 new, old = ktime_to_ns(cfs_b->period);
5267 
5268                         /*
5269                          * Grow period by a factor of 2 to avoid losing precision.
5270                          * Precision loss in the quota/period ratio can cause __cfs_schedulable
5271                          * to fail.
5272                          */
5273                         new = old * 2;
5274                         if (new < max_cfs_quota_period) {
5275                                 cfs_b->period = ns_to_ktime(new);
5276                                 cfs_b->quota *= 2;
5277 
5278                                 pr_warn_ratelimited(
5279         "cfs_period_timer[cpu%d]: period too short, scaling up (new cfs_period_us = %lld, cfs_quota_us = %lld)\n",
5280                                         smp_processor_id(),
5281                                         div_u64(new, NSEC_PER_USEC),
5282                                         div_u64(cfs_b->quota, NSEC_PER_USEC));
5283                         } else {
5284                                 pr_warn_ratelimited(
5285         "cfs_period_timer[cpu%d]: period too short, but cannot scale up without losing precision (cfs_period_us = %lld, cfs_quota_us = %lld)\n",
5286                                         smp_processor_id(),
5287                                         div_u64(old, NSEC_PER_USEC),
5288                                         div_u64(cfs_b->quota, NSEC_PER_USEC));
5289                         }
5290 
5291                         /* reset count so we don't come right back in here */
5292                         count = 0;
5293                 }
5294         }
5295         if (idle)
5296                 cfs_b->period_active = 0;
5297         raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&cfs_b->lock, flags);
5298 
5299         return idle ? HRTIMER_NORESTART : HRTIMER_RESTART;
5300 }
5301 
5302 void init_cfs_bandwidth(struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b)
     /*   */
5303 {
5304         raw_spin_lock_init(&cfs_b->lock);
5305         cfs_b->runtime = 0;
5306         cfs_b->quota = RUNTIME_INF;
5307         cfs_b->period = ns_to_ktime(default_cfs_period());
5308 
5309         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cfs_b->throttled_cfs_rq);
5310         hrtimer_init(&cfs_b->period_timer, CLOCK_MONOTONIC, HRTIMER_MODE_ABS_PINNED);
5311         cfs_b->period_timer.function = sched_cfs_period_timer;
5312         hrtimer_init(&cfs_b->slack_timer, CLOCK_MONOTONIC, HRTIMER_MODE_REL);
5313         cfs_b->slack_timer.function = sched_cfs_slack_timer;
5314         cfs_b->slack_started = false;
5315 }
5316 
5317 static void init_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
5318 {
5319         cfs_rq->runtime_enabled = 0;
5320         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cfs_rq->throttled_list);
5321 }
5322 
5323 void start_cfs_bandwidth(struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b)
     /*   */
5324 {
5325         lockdep_assert_held(&cfs_b->lock);
5326 
5327         if (cfs_b->period_active)
5328                 return;
5329 
5330         cfs_b->period_active = 1;
5331         hrtimer_forward_now(&cfs_b->period_timer, cfs_b->period);
5332         hrtimer_start_expires(&cfs_b->period_timer, HRTIMER_MODE_ABS_PINNED);
5333 }
5334 
5335 static void destroy_cfs_bandwidth(struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b)
     /*   */
5336 {
5337         /* init_cfs_bandwidth() was not called */
5338         if (!cfs_b->throttled_cfs_rq.next)
5339                 return;
5340 
5341         hrtimer_cancel(&cfs_b->period_timer);
5342         hrtimer_cancel(&cfs_b->slack_timer);
5343 }
5344 
5345 /*
5346  * Both these CPU hotplug callbacks race against unregister_fair_sched_group()
5347  *
5348  * The race is harmless, since modifying bandwidth settings of unhooked group
5349  * bits doesn't do much.
5350  */
5351 
5352 /* cpu online calback */
5353 static void __maybe_unused update_runtime_enabled(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
5354 {
5355         struct task_group *tg;
5356 
5357         lockdep_assert_held(&rq->lock);
5358 
5359         rcu_read_lock();
5360         list_for_each_entry_rcu(tg, &task_groups, list) {
5361                 struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b = &tg->cfs_bandwidth;
5362                 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = tg->cfs_rq[cpu_of(rq)];
5363 
5364                 raw_spin_lock(&cfs_b->lock);
5365                 cfs_rq->runtime_enabled = cfs_b->quota != RUNTIME_INF;
5366                 raw_spin_unlock(&cfs_b->lock);
5367         }
5368         rcu_read_unlock();
5369 }
5370 
5371 /* cpu offline callback */
5372 static void __maybe_unused unthrottle_offline_cfs_rqs(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
5373 {
5374         struct task_group *tg;
5375 
5376         lockdep_assert_held(&rq->lock);
5377 
5378         rcu_read_lock();
5379         list_for_each_entry_rcu(tg, &task_groups, list) {
5380                 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = tg->cfs_rq[cpu_of(rq)];
5381 
5382                 if (!cfs_rq->runtime_enabled)
5383                         continue;
5384 
5385                 /*
5386                  * clock_task is not advancing so we just need to make sure
5387                  * there's some valid quota amount
5388                  */
5389                 cfs_rq->runtime_remaining = 1;
5390                 /*
5391                  * Offline rq is schedulable till CPU is completely disabled
5392                  * in take_cpu_down(), so we prevent new cfs throttling here.
5393                  */
5394                 cfs_rq->runtime_enabled = 0;
5395 
5396                 if (cfs_rq_throttled(cfs_rq))
5397                         unthrottle_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
5398         }
5399         rcu_read_unlock();
5400 }
5401 
5402 #else /* CONFIG_CFS_BANDWIDTH */
5403 
5404 static inline bool cfs_bandwidth_used(void)
     /*   */
5405 {
5406         return false;
5407 }
5408 
5409 static void account_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, u64 delta_exec) {}
     /*   */
5410 static bool check_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq) { return false; }
     /*   */
5411 static void check_enqueue_throttle(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq) {}
     /*   */
5412 static inline void sync_throttle(struct task_group *tg, int cpu) {}
     /*   */
5413 static __always_inline void return_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq) {}
     /*   */
5414 
5415 static inline int cfs_rq_throttled(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
5416 {
5417         return 0;
5418 }
5419 
5420 static inline int throttled_hierarchy(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
5421 {
5422         return 0;
5423 }
5424 
5425 static inline int throttled_lb_pair(struct task_group *tg,
     /*   */
5426                                     int src_cpu, int dest_cpu)
5427 {
5428         return 0;
5429 }
5430 
5431 void init_cfs_bandwidth(struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b) {}
     /*   */
5432 
5433 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
5434 static void init_cfs_rq_runtime(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq) {}
     /*   */
5435 #endif
5436 
5437 static inline struct cfs_bandwidth *tg_cfs_bandwidth(struct task_group *tg)
     /*   */
5438 {
5439         return NULL;
5440 }
5441 static inline void destroy_cfs_bandwidth(struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b) {}
     /*   */
5442 static inline void update_runtime_enabled(struct rq *rq) {}
     /*   */
5443 static inline void unthrottle_offline_cfs_rqs(struct rq *rq) {}
     /*   */
5444 
5445 #endif /* CONFIG_CFS_BANDWIDTH */
5446 
5447 /**************************************************
5448  * CFS operations on tasks:
5449  */
5450 
5451 #ifdef CONFIG_SCHED_HRTICK
5452 static void hrtick_start_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
5453 {
5454         struct sched_entity *se = &p->se;
5455         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
5456 
5457         SCHED_WARN_ON(task_rq(p) != rq);
5458 
5459         if (rq->cfs.h_nr_running > 1) {
5460                 u64 slice = sched_slice(cfs_rq, se);
5461                 u64 ran = se->sum_exec_runtime - se->prev_sum_exec_runtime;
5462                 s64 delta = slice - ran;
5463 
5464                 if (delta < 0) {
5465                         if (rq->curr == p)
5466                                 resched_curr(rq);
5467                         return;
5468                 }
5469                 hrtick_start(rq, delta);
5470         }
5471 }
5472 
5473 /*
5474  * called from enqueue/dequeue and updates the hrtick when the
5475  * current task is from our class and nr_running is low enough
5476  * to matter.
5477  */
5478 static void hrtick_update(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
5479 {
5480         struct task_struct *curr = rq->curr;
5481 
5482         if (!hrtick_enabled(rq) || curr->sched_class != &fair_sched_class)
5483                 return;
5484 
5485         if (cfs_rq_of(&curr->se)->nr_running < sched_nr_latency)
5486                 hrtick_start_fair(rq, curr);
5487 }
5488 #else /* !CONFIG_SCHED_HRTICK */
5489 static inline void
5490 hrtick_start_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
5491 {
5492 }
5493 
5494 static inline void hrtick_update(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
5495 {
5496 }
5497 #endif
5498 
5499 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
5500 static inline unsigned long cpu_util(int cpu);
5501 
5502 static inline bool cpu_overutilized(int cpu)
     /*   */
5503 {
5504         int overutilized = -1;
5505 
5506         trace_android_rvh_cpu_overutilized(cpu, &overutilized);
5507         if (overutilized != -1)
5508                 return overutilized;
5509 
5510         return !fits_capacity(cpu_util(cpu), capacity_of(cpu));
5511 }
5512 
5513 static inline void update_overutilized_status(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
5514 {
5515         if (!READ_ONCE(rq->rd->overutilized) && cpu_overutilized(rq->cpu)) {
5516                 WRITE_ONCE(rq->rd->overutilized, SG_OVERUTILIZED);
5517                 trace_sched_overutilized_tp(rq->rd, SG_OVERUTILIZED);
5518         }
5519 }
5520 #else
5521 static inline void update_overutilized_status(struct rq *rq) { }
     /*   */
5522 #endif
5523 
5524 /* Runqueue only has SCHED_IDLE tasks enqueued */
5525 static int sched_idle_rq(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
5526 {
5527         return unlikely(rq->nr_running == rq->cfs.idle_h_nr_running &&
5528                         rq->nr_running);
5529 }
5530 
5531 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
5532 static int sched_idle_cpu(int cpu)
     /*   */
5533 {
5534         return sched_idle_rq(cpu_rq(cpu));
5535 }
5536 #endif
5537 
5538 /*
5539  * The enqueue_task method is called before nr_running is
5540  * increased. Here we update the fair scheduling stats and
5541  * then put the task into the rbtree:
5542  */
5543 static void
5544 enqueue_task_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p, int flags)
     /*   */
5545 {
5546         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
5547         struct sched_entity *se = &p->se;
5548         int idle_h_nr_running = task_has_idle_policy(p);
5549         int task_new = !(flags & ENQUEUE_WAKEUP);
5550         int should_iowait_boost;
5551 
5552         /*
5553          * The code below (indirectly) updates schedutil which looks at
5554          * the cfs_rq utilization to select a frequency.
5555          * Let's add the task's estimated utilization to the cfs_rq's
5556          * estimated utilization, before we update schedutil.
5557          */
5558         util_est_enqueue(&rq->cfs, p);
5559 
5560         /*
5561          * If in_iowait is set, the code below may not trigger any cpufreq
5562          * utilization updates, so do it here explicitly with the IOWAIT flag
5563          * passed.
5564          */
5565         should_iowait_boost = p->in_iowait;
5566         trace_android_rvh_set_iowait(p, &should_iowait_boost);
5567         if (should_iowait_boost)
5568                 cpufreq_update_util(rq, SCHED_CPUFREQ_IOWAIT);
5569 
5570         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
5571                 if (se->on_rq)
5572                         break;
5573                 cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
5574                 enqueue_entity(cfs_rq, se, flags);
5575 
5576                 cfs_rq->h_nr_running++;
5577                 cfs_rq->idle_h_nr_running += idle_h_nr_running;
5578 
5579                 /* end evaluation on encountering a throttled cfs_rq */
5580                 if (cfs_rq_throttled(cfs_rq))
5581                         goto enqueue_throttle;
5582 
5583                 flags = ENQUEUE_WAKEUP;
5584         }
5585 
5586         trace_android_rvh_enqueue_task_fair(rq, p, flags);
5587         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
5588                 cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
5589 
5590                 update_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, UPDATE_TG);
5591                 se_update_runnable(se);
5592                 update_cfs_group(se);
5593 
5594                 cfs_rq->h_nr_running++;
5595                 cfs_rq->idle_h_nr_running += idle_h_nr_running;
5596 
5597                 /* end evaluation on encountering a throttled cfs_rq */
5598                 if (cfs_rq_throttled(cfs_rq))
5599                         goto enqueue_throttle;
5600 
5601                /*
5602                 * One parent has been throttled and cfs_rq removed from the
5603                 * list. Add it back to not break the leaf list.
5604                 */
5605                if (throttled_hierarchy(cfs_rq))
5606                        list_add_leaf_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
5607         }
5608 
5609         /* At this point se is NULL and we are at root level*/
5610         add_nr_running(rq, 1);
5611 
5612         /*
5613          * Since new tasks are assigned an initial util_avg equal to
5614          * half of the spare capacity of their CPU, tiny tasks have the
5615          * ability to cross the overutilized threshold, which will
5616          * result in the load balancer ruining all the task placement
5617          * done by EAS. As a way to mitigate that effect, do not account
5618          * for the first enqueue operation of new tasks during the
5619          * overutilized flag detection.
5620          *
5621          * A better way of solving this problem would be to wait for
5622          * the PELT signals of tasks to converge before taking them
5623          * into account, but that is not straightforward to implement,
5624          * and the following generally works well enough in practice.
5625          */
5626         if (!task_new)
5627                 update_overutilized_status(rq);
5628 
5629 enqueue_throttle:
5630         if (cfs_bandwidth_used()) {
5631                 /*
5632                  * When bandwidth control is enabled; the cfs_rq_throttled()
5633                  * breaks in the above iteration can result in incomplete
5634                  * leaf list maintenance, resulting in triggering the assertion
5635                  * below.
5636                  */
5637                 for_each_sched_entity(se) {
5638                         cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
5639 
5640                         if (list_add_leaf_cfs_rq(cfs_rq))
5641                                 break;
5642                 }
5643         }
5644 
5645         assert_list_leaf_cfs_rq(rq);
5646 
5647         hrtick_update(rq);
5648 }
5649 
5650 static void set_next_buddy(struct sched_entity *se);
5651 
5652 /*
5653  * The dequeue_task method is called before nr_running is
5654  * decreased. We remove the task from the rbtree and
5655  * update the fair scheduling stats:
5656  */
5657 static void dequeue_task_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p, int flags)
     /*   */
5658 {
5659         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
5660         struct sched_entity *se = &p->se;
5661         int task_sleep = flags & DEQUEUE_SLEEP;
5662         int idle_h_nr_running = task_has_idle_policy(p);
5663         bool was_sched_idle = sched_idle_rq(rq);
5664 
5665         util_est_dequeue(&rq->cfs, p);
5666 
5667         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
5668                 cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
5669                 dequeue_entity(cfs_rq, se, flags);
5670 
5671                 cfs_rq->h_nr_running--;
5672                 cfs_rq->idle_h_nr_running -= idle_h_nr_running;
5673 
5674                 /* end evaluation on encountering a throttled cfs_rq */
5675                 if (cfs_rq_throttled(cfs_rq))
5676                         goto dequeue_throttle;
5677 
5678                 /* Don't dequeue parent if it has other entities besides us */
5679                 if (cfs_rq->load.weight) {
5680                         /* Avoid re-evaluating load for this entity: */
5681                         se = parent_entity(se);
5682                         /*
5683                          * Bias pick_next to pick a task from this cfs_rq, as
5684                          * p is sleeping when it is within its sched_slice.
5685                          */
5686                         if (task_sleep && se && !throttled_hierarchy(cfs_rq))
5687                                 set_next_buddy(se);
5688                         break;
5689                 }
5690                 flags |= DEQUEUE_SLEEP;
5691         }
5692 
5693         trace_android_rvh_dequeue_task_fair(rq, p, flags);
5694         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
5695                 cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
5696 
5697                 update_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, UPDATE_TG);
5698                 se_update_runnable(se);
5699                 update_cfs_group(se);
5700 
5701                 cfs_rq->h_nr_running--;
5702                 cfs_rq->idle_h_nr_running -= idle_h_nr_running;
5703 
5704                 /* end evaluation on encountering a throttled cfs_rq */
5705                 if (cfs_rq_throttled(cfs_rq))
5706                         goto dequeue_throttle;
5707 
5708         }
5709 
5710         /* At this point se is NULL and we are at root level*/
5711         sub_nr_running(rq, 1);
5712 
5713         /* balance early to pull high priority tasks */
5714         if (unlikely(!was_sched_idle && sched_idle_rq(rq)))
5715                 rq->next_balance = jiffies;
5716 
5717 dequeue_throttle:
5718         util_est_update(&rq->cfs, p, task_sleep);
5719         hrtick_update(rq);
5720 }
5721 
5722 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
5723 
5724 /* Working cpumask for: load_balance, load_balance_newidle. */
5725 DEFINE_PER_CPU(cpumask_var_t, load_balance_mask);
5726 DEFINE_PER_CPU(cpumask_var_t, select_idle_mask);
5727 
5728 #ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
5729 
5730 static struct {
5731         cpumask_var_t idle_cpus_mask;
5732         atomic_t nr_cpus;
5733         int has_blocked;                /* Idle CPUS has blocked load */
5734         unsigned long next_balance;     /* in jiffy units */
5735         unsigned long next_blocked;     /* Next update of blocked load in jiffies */
5736 } nohz ____cacheline_aligned;
5737 
5738 #endif /* CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON */
5739 
5740 static unsigned long cpu_load(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
5741 {
5742         return cfs_rq_load_avg(&rq->cfs);
5743 }
5744 
5745 /*
5746  * cpu_load_without - compute CPU load without any contributions from *p
5747  * @cpu: the CPU which load is requested
5748  * @p: the task which load should be discounted
5749  *
5750  * The load of a CPU is defined by the load of tasks currently enqueued on that
5751  * CPU as well as tasks which are currently sleeping after an execution on that
5752  * CPU.
5753  *
5754  * This method returns the load of the specified CPU by discounting the load of
5755  * the specified task, whenever the task is currently contributing to the CPU
5756  * load.
5757  */
5758 static unsigned long cpu_load_without(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
5759 {
5760         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
5761         unsigned int load;
5762 
5763         /* Task has no contribution or is new */
5764         if (cpu_of(rq) != task_cpu(p) || !READ_ONCE(p->se.avg.last_update_time))
5765                 return cpu_load(rq);
5766 
5767         cfs_rq = &rq->cfs;
5768         load = READ_ONCE(cfs_rq->avg.load_avg);
5769 
5770         /* Discount task's util from CPU's util */
5771         lsub_positive(&load, task_h_load(p));
5772 
5773         return load;
5774 }
5775 
5776 static unsigned long cpu_runnable(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
5777 {
5778         return cfs_rq_runnable_avg(&rq->cfs);
5779 }
5780 
5781 static unsigned long cpu_runnable_without(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
5782 {
5783         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
5784         unsigned int runnable;
5785 
5786         /* Task has no contribution or is new */
5787         if (cpu_of(rq) != task_cpu(p) || !READ_ONCE(p->se.avg.last_update_time))
5788                 return cpu_runnable(rq);
5789 
5790         cfs_rq = &rq->cfs;
5791         runnable = READ_ONCE(cfs_rq->avg.runnable_avg);
5792 
5793         /* Discount task's runnable from CPU's runnable */
5794         lsub_positive(&runnable, p->se.avg.runnable_avg);
5795 
5796         return runnable;
5797 }
5798 
5799 static unsigned long capacity_of(int cpu)
     /*   */
5800 {
5801         return cpu_rq(cpu)->cpu_capacity;
5802 }
5803 
5804 static void record_wakee(struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
5805 {
5806         /*
5807          * Only decay a single time; tasks that have less then 1 wakeup per
5808          * jiffy will not have built up many flips.
5809          */
5810         if (time_after(jiffies, current->wakee_flip_decay_ts + HZ)) {
5811                 current->wakee_flips >>= 1;
5812                 current->wakee_flip_decay_ts = jiffies;
5813         }
5814 
5815         if (current->last_wakee != p) {
5816                 current->last_wakee = p;
5817                 current->wakee_flips++;
5818         }
5819 }
5820 
5821 /*
5822  * Detect M:N waker/wakee relationships via a switching-frequency heuristic.
5823  *
5824  * A waker of many should wake a different task than the one last awakened
5825  * at a frequency roughly N times higher than one of its wakees.
5826  *
5827  * In order to determine whether we should let the load spread vs consolidating
5828  * to shared cache, we look for a minimum 'flip' frequency of llc_size in one
5829  * partner, and a factor of lls_size higher frequency in the other.
5830  *
5831  * With both conditions met, we can be relatively sure that the relationship is
5832  * non-monogamous, with partner count exceeding socket size.
5833  *
5834  * Waker/wakee being client/server, worker/dispatcher, interrupt source or
5835  * whatever is irrelevant, spread criteria is apparent partner count exceeds
5836  * socket size.
5837  */
5838 static int wake_wide(struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
5839 {
5840         unsigned int master = current->wakee_flips;
5841         unsigned int slave = p->wakee_flips;
5842         int factor = __this_cpu_read(sd_llc_size);
5843 
5844         if (master < slave)
5845                 swap(master, slave);
5846         if (slave < factor || master < slave * factor)
5847                 return 0;
5848         return 1;
5849 }
5850 
5851 /*
5852  * The purpose of wake_affine() is to quickly determine on which CPU we can run
5853  * soonest. For the purpose of speed we only consider the waking and previous
5854  * CPU.
5855  *
5856  * wake_affine_idle() - only considers 'now', it check if the waking CPU is
5857  *                      cache-affine and is (or will be) idle.
5858  *
5859  * wake_affine_weight() - considers the weight to reflect the average
5860  *                        scheduling latency of the CPUs. This seems to work
5861  *                        for the overloaded case.
5862  */
5863 static int
5864 wake_affine_idle(int this_cpu, int prev_cpu, int sync)
     /*   */
5865 {
5866         /*
5867          * If this_cpu is idle, it implies the wakeup is from interrupt
5868          * context. Only allow the move if cache is shared. Otherwise an
5869          * interrupt intensive workload could force all tasks onto one
5870          * node depending on the IO topology or IRQ affinity settings.
5871          *
5872          * If the prev_cpu is idle and cache affine then avoid a migration.
5873          * There is no guarantee that the cache hot data from an interrupt
5874          * is more important than cache hot data on the prev_cpu and from
5875          * a cpufreq perspective, it's better to have higher utilisation
5876          * on one CPU.
5877          */
5878         if (available_idle_cpu(this_cpu) && cpus_share_cache(this_cpu, prev_cpu))
5879                 return available_idle_cpu(prev_cpu) ? prev_cpu : this_cpu;
5880 
5881         if (sync && cpu_rq(this_cpu)->nr_running == 1)
5882                 return this_cpu;
5883 
5884         return nr_cpumask_bits;
5885 }
5886 
5887 static int
5888 wake_affine_weight(struct sched_domain *sd, struct task_struct *p,
     /*   */
5889                    int this_cpu, int prev_cpu, int sync)
5890 {
5891         s64 this_eff_load, prev_eff_load;
5892         unsigned long task_load;
5893 
5894         this_eff_load = cpu_load(cpu_rq(this_cpu));
5895 
5896         if (sync) {
5897                 unsigned long current_load = task_h_load(current);
5898 
5899                 if (current_load > this_eff_load)
5900                         return this_cpu;
5901 
5902                 this_eff_load -= current_load;
5903         }
5904 
5905         task_load = task_h_load(p);
5906 
5907         this_eff_load += task_load;
5908         if (sched_feat(WA_BIAS))
5909                 this_eff_load *= 100;
5910         this_eff_load *= capacity_of(prev_cpu);
5911 
5912         prev_eff_load = cpu_load(cpu_rq(prev_cpu));
5913         prev_eff_load -= task_load;
5914         if (sched_feat(WA_BIAS))
5915                 prev_eff_load *= 100 + (sd->imbalance_pct - 100) / 2;
5916         prev_eff_load *= capacity_of(this_cpu);
5917 
5918         /*
5919          * If sync, adjust the weight of prev_eff_load such that if
5920          * prev_eff == this_eff that select_idle_sibling() will consider
5921          * stacking the wakee on top of the waker if no other CPU is
5922          * idle.
5923          */
5924         if (sync)
5925                 prev_eff_load += 1;
5926 
5927         return this_eff_load < prev_eff_load ? this_cpu : nr_cpumask_bits;
5928 }
5929 
5930 static int wake_affine(struct sched_domain *sd, struct task_struct *p,
     /*   */
5931                        int this_cpu, int prev_cpu, int sync)
5932 {
5933         int target = nr_cpumask_bits;
5934 
5935         if (sched_feat(WA_IDLE))
5936                 target = wake_affine_idle(this_cpu, prev_cpu, sync);
5937 
5938         if (sched_feat(WA_WEIGHT) && target == nr_cpumask_bits)
5939                 target = wake_affine_weight(sd, p, this_cpu, prev_cpu, sync);
5940 
5941         schedstat_inc(p->se.statistics.nr_wakeups_affine_attempts);
5942         if (target == nr_cpumask_bits)
5943                 return prev_cpu;
5944 
5945         schedstat_inc(sd->ttwu_move_affine);
5946         schedstat_inc(p->se.statistics.nr_wakeups_affine);
5947         return target;
5948 }
5949 
5950 static struct sched_group *
5951 find_idlest_group(struct sched_domain *sd, struct task_struct *p, int this_cpu);
5952 
5953 /*
5954  * find_idlest_group_cpu - find the idlest CPU among the CPUs in the group.
5955  */
5956 static int
5957 find_idlest_group_cpu(struct sched_group *group, struct task_struct *p, int this_cpu)
     /*   */
5958 {
5959         unsigned long load, min_load = ULONG_MAX;
5960         unsigned int min_exit_latency = UINT_MAX;
5961         u64 latest_idle_timestamp = 0;
5962         int least_loaded_cpu = this_cpu;
5963         int shallowest_idle_cpu = -1;
5964         int i;
5965 
5966         /* Check if we have any choice: */
5967         if (group->group_weight == 1)
5968                 return cpumask_first(sched_group_span(group));
5969 
5970         /* Traverse only the allowed CPUs */
5971         for_each_cpu_and(i, sched_group_span(group), p->cpus_ptr) {
5972                 if (sched_idle_cpu(i))
5973                         return i;
5974 
5975                 if (available_idle_cpu(i)) {
5976                         struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(i);
5977                         struct cpuidle_state *idle = idle_get_state(rq);
5978                         if (idle && idle->exit_latency < min_exit_latency) {
5979                                 /*
5980                                  * We give priority to a CPU whose idle state
5981                                  * has the smallest exit latency irrespective
5982                                  * of any idle timestamp.
5983                                  */
5984                                 min_exit_latency = idle->exit_latency;
5985                                 latest_idle_timestamp = rq->idle_stamp;
5986                                 shallowest_idle_cpu = i;
5987                         } else if ((!idle || idle->exit_latency == min_exit_latency) &&
5988                                    rq->idle_stamp > latest_idle_timestamp) {
5989                                 /*
5990                                  * If equal or no active idle state, then
5991                                  * the most recently idled CPU might have
5992                                  * a warmer cache.
5993                                  */
5994                                 latest_idle_timestamp = rq->idle_stamp;
5995                                 shallowest_idle_cpu = i;
5996                         }
5997                 } else if (shallowest_idle_cpu == -1) {
5998                         load = cpu_load(cpu_rq(i));
5999                         if (load < min_load) {
6000                                 min_load = load;
6001                                 least_loaded_cpu = i;
6002                         }
6003                 }
6004         }
6005 
6006         return shallowest_idle_cpu != -1 ? shallowest_idle_cpu : least_loaded_cpu;
6007 }
6008 
6009 static inline int find_idlest_cpu(struct sched_domain *sd, struct task_struct *p,
     /*   */
6010                                   int cpu, int prev_cpu, int sd_flag)
6011 {
6012         int new_cpu = cpu;
6013 
6014         if (!cpumask_intersects(sched_domain_span(sd), p->cpus_ptr))
6015                 return prev_cpu;
6016 
6017         /*
6018          * We need task's util for cpu_util_without, sync it up to
6019          * prev_cpu's last_update_time.
6020          */
6021         if (!(sd_flag & SD_BALANCE_FORK))
6022                 sync_entity_load_avg(&p->se);
6023 
6024         while (sd) {
6025                 struct sched_group *group;
6026                 struct sched_domain *tmp;
6027                 int weight;
6028 
6029                 if (!(sd->flags & sd_flag)) {
6030                         sd = sd->child;
6031                         continue;
6032                 }
6033 
6034                 group = find_idlest_group(sd, p, cpu);
6035                 if (!group) {
6036                         sd = sd->child;
6037                         continue;
6038                 }
6039 
6040                 new_cpu = find_idlest_group_cpu(group, p, cpu);
6041                 if (new_cpu == cpu) {
6042                         /* Now try balancing at a lower domain level of 'cpu': */
6043                         sd = sd->child;
6044                         continue;
6045                 }
6046 
6047                 /* Now try balancing at a lower domain level of 'new_cpu': */
6048                 cpu = new_cpu;
6049                 weight = sd->span_weight;
6050                 sd = NULL;
6051                 for_each_domain(cpu, tmp) {
6052                         if (weight <= tmp->span_weight)
6053                                 break;
6054                         if (tmp->flags & sd_flag)
6055                                 sd = tmp;
6056                 }
6057         }
6058 
6059         return new_cpu;
6060 }
6061 
6062 #ifdef CONFIG_SCHED_SMT
6063 DEFINE_STATIC_KEY_FALSE(sched_smt_present);
6064 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(sched_smt_present);
6065 
6066 static inline void set_idle_cores(int cpu, int val)
     /*   */
6067 {
6068         struct sched_domain_shared *sds;
6069 
6070         sds = rcu_dereference(per_cpu(sd_llc_shared, cpu));
6071         if (sds)
6072                 WRITE_ONCE(sds->has_idle_cores, val);
6073 }
6074 
6075 static inline bool test_idle_cores(int cpu, bool def)
     /*   */
6076 {
6077         struct sched_domain_shared *sds;
6078 
6079         sds = rcu_dereference(per_cpu(sd_llc_shared, cpu));
6080         if (sds)
6081                 return READ_ONCE(sds->has_idle_cores);
6082 
6083         return def;
6084 }
6085 
6086 /*
6087  * Scans the local SMT mask to see if the entire core is idle, and records this
6088  * information in sd_llc_shared->has_idle_cores.
6089  *
6090  * Since SMT siblings share all cache levels, inspecting this limited remote
6091  * state should be fairly cheap.
6092  */
6093 void __update_idle_core(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
6094 {
6095         int core = cpu_of(rq);
6096         int cpu;
6097 
6098         rcu_read_lock();
6099         if (test_idle_cores(core, true))
6100                 goto unlock;
6101 
6102         for_each_cpu(cpu, cpu_smt_mask(core)) {
6103                 if (cpu == core)
6104                         continue;
6105 
6106                 if (!available_idle_cpu(cpu))
6107                         goto unlock;
6108         }
6109 
6110         set_idle_cores(core, 1);
6111 unlock:
6112         rcu_read_unlock();
6113 }
6114 
6115 /*
6116  * Scan the entire LLC domain for idle cores; this dynamically switches off if
6117  * there are no idle cores left in the system; tracked through
6118  * sd_llc->shared->has_idle_cores and enabled through update_idle_core() above.
6119  */
6120 static int select_idle_core(struct task_struct *p, struct sched_domain *sd, int target)
     /*   */
6121 {
6122         struct cpumask *cpus = this_cpu_cpumask_var_ptr(select_idle_mask);
6123         int core, cpu;
6124 
6125         if (!static_branch_likely(&sched_smt_present))
6126                 return -1;
6127 
6128         if (!test_idle_cores(target, false))
6129                 return -1;
6130 
6131         cpumask_and(cpus, sched_domain_span(sd), p->cpus_ptr);
6132 
6133         for_each_cpu_wrap(core, cpus, target) {
6134                 bool idle = true;
6135 
6136                 for_each_cpu(cpu, cpu_smt_mask(core)) {
6137                         if (!available_idle_cpu(cpu)) {
6138                                 idle = false;
6139                                 break;
6140                         }
6141                 }
6142                 cpumask_andnot(cpus, cpus, cpu_smt_mask(core));
6143 
6144                 if (idle)
6145                         return core;
6146         }
6147 
6148         /*
6149          * Failed to find an idle core; stop looking for one.
6150          */
6151         set_idle_cores(target, 0);
6152 
6153         return -1;
6154 }
6155 
6156 /*
6157  * Scan the local SMT mask for idle CPUs.
6158  */
6159 static int select_idle_smt(struct task_struct *p, struct sched_domain *sd, int target)
     /*   */
6160 {
6161         int cpu;
6162 
6163         if (!static_branch_likely(&sched_smt_present))
6164                 return -1;
6165 
6166         for_each_cpu(cpu, cpu_smt_mask(target)) {
6167                 if (!cpumask_test_cpu(cpu, p->cpus_ptr) ||
6168                     !cpumask_test_cpu(cpu, sched_domain_span(sd)))
6169                         continue;
6170                 if (available_idle_cpu(cpu) || sched_idle_cpu(cpu))
6171                         return cpu;
6172         }
6173 
6174         return -1;
6175 }
6176 
6177 #else /* CONFIG_SCHED_SMT */
6178
