8175         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = &rq->cfs;
8176         bool decayed;
8177 
8178         decayed = update_cfs_rq_load_avg(cfs_rq_clock_pelt(cfs_rq), cfs_rq);
8179         if (cfs_rq_has_blocked(cfs_rq))
8180                 *done = false;
8181 
8182         return decayed;
8183 }
8184 
8185 static unsigned long task_h_load(struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
8186 {
8187         return p->se.avg.load_avg;
8188 }
8189 #endif
8190 
8191 static void update_blocked_averages(int cpu)
     /*   */
8192 {
8193         bool decayed = false, done = true;
8194         struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
8195         struct rq_flags rf;
8196 
8197         rq_lock_irqsave(rq, &rf);
8198         update_rq_clock(rq);
8199 
8200         decayed |= __update_blocked_others(rq, &done);
8201         decayed |= __update_blocked_fair(rq, &done);
8202 
8203         update_blocked_load_status(rq, !done);
8204         if (decayed)
8205                 cpufreq_update_util(rq, 0);
8206         rq_unlock_irqrestore(rq, &rf);
8207 }
8208 
8209 /********** Helpers for find_busiest_group ************************/
8210 
8211 /*
8212  * sg_lb_stats - stats of a sched_group required for load_balancing
8213  */
8214 struct sg_lb_stats {
8215         unsigned long avg_load; /*Avg load across the CPUs of the group */
8216         unsigned long group_load; /* Total load over the CPUs of the group */
8217         unsigned long group_capacity;
8218         unsigned long group_util; /* Total utilization over the CPUs of the group */
8219         unsigned long group_runnable; /* Total runnable time over the CPUs of the group */
8220         unsigned int sum_nr_running; /* Nr of tasks running in the group */
8221         unsigned int sum_h_nr_running; /* Nr of CFS tasks running in the group */
8222         unsigned int idle_cpus;
8223         unsigned int group_weight;
8224         enum group_type group_type;
8225         unsigned int group_asym_packing; /* Tasks should be moved to preferred CPU */
8226         unsigned long group_misfit_task_load; /* A CPU has a task too big for its capacity */
8227 #ifdef CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING
8228         unsigned int nr_numa_running;
8229         unsigned int nr_preferred_running;
8230 #endif
8231 };
8232 
8233 /*
8234  * sd_lb_stats - Structure to store the statistics of a sched_domain
8235  *               during load balancing.
8236  */
8237 struct sd_lb_stats {
8238         struct sched_group *busiest;    /* Busiest group in this sd */
8239         struct sched_group *local;      /* Local group in this sd */
8240         unsigned long total_load;       /* Total load of all groups in sd */
8241         unsigned long total_capacity;   /* Total capacity of all groups in sd */
8242         unsigned long avg_load; /* Average load across all groups in sd */
8243         unsigned int prefer_sibling; /* tasks should go to sibling first */
8244 
8245         struct sg_lb_stats busiest_stat;/* Statistics of the busiest group */
8246         struct sg_lb_stats local_stat;  /* Statistics of the local group */
8247 };
8248 
8249 static inline void init_sd_lb_stats(struct sd_lb_stats *sds)
     /*   */
8250 {
8251         /*
8252          * Skimp on the clearing to avoid duplicate work. We can avoid clearing
8253          * local_stat because update_sg_lb_stats() does a full clear/assignment.
8254          * We must however set busiest_stat::group_type and
8255          * busiest_stat::idle_cpus to the worst busiest group because
8256          * update_sd_pick_busiest() reads these before assignment.
8257          */
8258         *sds = (struct sd_lb_stats){
8259                 .busiest = NULL,
8260                 .local = NULL,
8261                 .total_load = 0UL,
8262                 .total_capacity = 0UL,
8263                 .busiest_stat = {
8264                         .idle_cpus = UINT_MAX,
8265                         .group_type = group_has_spare,
8266                 },
8267         };
8268 }
8269 
8270 static unsigned long scale_rt_capacity(int cpu)
     /*   */
8271 {
8272         struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
8273         unsigned long max = arch_scale_cpu_capacity(cpu);
8274         unsigned long used, free;
8275         unsigned long irq;
8276 
8277         irq = cpu_util_irq(rq);
8278 
8279         if (unlikely(irq >= max))
8280                 return 1;
8281 
8282         /*
8283          * avg_rt.util_avg and avg_dl.util_avg track binary signals
8284          * (running and not running) with weights 0 and 1024 respectively.
8285          * avg_thermal.load_avg tracks thermal pressure and the weighted
8286          * average uses the actual delta max capacity(load).
8287          */
8288         used = READ_ONCE(rq->avg_rt.util_avg);
8289         used += READ_ONCE(rq->avg_dl.util_avg);
8290         used += thermal_load_avg(rq);
8291 
8292         if (unlikely(used >= max))
8293                 return 1;
8294 
8295         free = max - used;
8296 
8297         return scale_irq_capacity(free, irq, max);
8298 }
8299 
8300 static void update_cpu_capacity(struct sched_domain *sd, int cpu)
     /*   */
8301 {
8302         unsigned long capacity = scale_rt_capacity(cpu);
8303         struct sched_group *sdg = sd->groups;
8304 
8305         cpu_rq(cpu)->cpu_capacity_orig = arch_scale_cpu_capacity(cpu);
8306 
8307         if (!capacity)
8308                 capacity = 1;
8309 
8310         trace_android_rvh_update_cpu_capacity(cpu, &capacity);
8311         cpu_rq(cpu)->cpu_capacity = capacity;
8312         trace_sched_cpu_capacity_tp(cpu_rq(cpu));
8313 
8314         sdg->sgc->capacity = capacity;
8315         sdg->sgc->min_capacity = capacity;
8316         sdg->sgc->max_capacity = capacity;
8317 }
8318 
8319 void update_group_capacity(struct sched_domain *sd, int cpu)
     /*   */
8320 {
8321         struct sched_domain *child = sd->child;
8322         struct sched_group *group, *sdg = sd->groups;
8323         unsigned long capacity, min_capacity, max_capacity;
8324         unsigned long interval;
8325 
8326         interval = msecs_to_jiffies(sd->balance_interval);
8327         interval = clamp(interval, 1UL, max_load_balance_interval);
8328         sdg->sgc->next_update = jiffies + interval;
8329 
8330         if (!child) {
8331                 update_cpu_capacity(sd, cpu);
8332                 return;
8333         }
8334 
8335         capacity = 0;
8336         min_capacity = ULONG_MAX;
8337         max_capacity = 0;
8338 
8339         if (child->flags & SD_OVERLAP) {
8340                 /*
8341                  * SD_OVERLAP domains cannot assume that child groups
8342                  * span the current group.
8343                  */
8344 
8345                 for_each_cpu(cpu, sched_group_span(sdg)) {
8346                         unsigned long cpu_cap = capacity_of(cpu);
8347 
8348                         capacity += cpu_cap;
8349                         min_capacity = min(cpu_cap, min_capacity);
8350                         max_capacity = max(cpu_cap, max_capacity);
8351                 }
8352         } else  {
8353                 /*
8354                  * !SD_OVERLAP domains can assume that child groups
8355                  * span the current group.
8356                  */
8357 
8358                 group = child->groups;
8359                 do {
8360                         struct sched_group_capacity *sgc = group->sgc;
8361 
8362                         capacity += sgc->capacity;
8363                         min_capacity = min(sgc->min_capacity, min_capacity);
8364                         max_capacity = max(sgc->max_capacity, max_capacity);
8365                         group = group->next;
8366                 } while (group != child->groups);
8367         }
8368 
8369         sdg->sgc->capacity = capacity;
8370         sdg->sgc->min_capacity = min_capacity;
8371         sdg->sgc->max_capacity = max_capacity;
8372 }
8373 
8374 /*
8375  * Check whether the capacity of the rq has been noticeably reduced by side
8376  * activity. The imbalance_pct is used for the threshold.
8377  * Return true is the capacity is reduced
8378  */
8379 static inline int
8380 check_cpu_capacity(struct rq *rq, struct sched_domain *sd)
     /*   */
8381 {
8382         return ((rq->cpu_capacity * sd->imbalance_pct) <
8383                                 (rq->cpu_capacity_orig * 100));
8384 }
8385 
8386 /*
8387  * Check whether a rq has a misfit task and if it looks like we can actually
8388  * help that task: we can migrate the task to a CPU of higher capacity, or
8389  * the task's current CPU is heavily pressured.
8390  */
8391 static inline int check_misfit_status(struct rq *rq, struct sched_domain *sd)
     /*   */
8392 {
8393         return rq->misfit_task_load &&
8394                 (rq->cpu_capacity_orig < rq->rd->max_cpu_capacity ||
8395                  check_cpu_capacity(rq, sd));
8396 }
8397 
8398 /*
8399  * Group imbalance indicates (and tries to solve) the problem where balancing
8400  * groups is inadequate due to ->cpus_ptr constraints.
8401  *
8402  * Imagine a situation of two groups of 4 CPUs each and 4 tasks each with a
8403  * cpumask covering 1 CPU of the first group and 3 CPUs of the second group.
8404  * Something like:
8405  *
8406  *      { 0 1 2 3 } { 4 5 6 7 }
8407  *              *     * * *
8408  *
8409  * If we were to balance group-wise we'd place two tasks in the first group and
8410  * two tasks in the second group. Clearly this is undesired as it will overload
8411  * cpu 3 and leave one of the CPUs in the second group unused.
8412  *
8413  * The current solution to this issue is detecting the skew in the first group
8414  * by noticing the lower domain failed to reach balance and had difficulty
8415  * moving tasks due to affinity constraints.
8416  *
8417  * When this is so detected; this group becomes a candidate for busiest; see
8418  * update_sd_pick_busiest(). And calculate_imbalance() and
8419  * find_busiest_group() avoid some of the usual balance conditions to allow it
8420  * to create an effective group imbalance.
8421  *
8422  * This is a somewhat tricky proposition since the next run might not find the
8423  * group imbalance and decide the groups need to be balanced again. A most
8424  * subtle and fragile situation.
8425  */
8426 
8427 static inline int sg_imbalanced(struct sched_group *group)
     /*   */
8428 {
8429         return group->sgc->imbalance;
8430 }
8431 
8432 /*
8433  * group_has_capacity returns true if the group has spare capacity that could
8434  * be used by some tasks.
8435  * We consider that a group has spare capacity if the  * number of task is
8436  * smaller than the number of CPUs or if the utilization is lower than the
8437  * available capacity for CFS tasks.
8438  * For the latter, we use a threshold to stabilize the state, to take into
8439  * account the variance of the tasks' load and to return true if the available
8440  * capacity in meaningful for the load balancer.
8441  * As an example, an available capacity of 1% can appear but it doesn't make
8442  * any benefit for the load balance.
8443  */
8444 static inline bool
8445 group_has_capacity(unsigned int imbalance_pct, struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
     /*   */
8446 {
8447         if (sgs->sum_nr_running < sgs->group_weight)
8448                 return true;
8449 
8450         if ((sgs->group_capacity * imbalance_pct) <
8451                         (sgs->group_runnable * 100))
8452                 return false;
8453 
8454         if ((sgs->group_capacity * 100) >
8455                         (sgs->group_util * imbalance_pct))
8456                 return true;
8457 
8458         return false;
8459 }
8460 
8461 /*
8462  *  group_is_overloaded returns true if the group has more tasks than it can
8463  *  handle.
8464  *  group_is_overloaded is not equals to !group_has_capacity because a group
8465  *  with the exact right number of tasks, has no more spare capacity but is not
8466  *  overloaded so both group_has_capacity and group_is_overloaded return
8467  *  false.
8468  */
8469 static inline bool
8470 group_is_overloaded(unsigned int imbalance_pct, struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
     /*   */
8471 {
8472         if (sgs->sum_nr_running <= sgs->group_weight)
8473                 return false;
8474 
8475         if ((sgs->group_capacity * 100) <
8476                         (sgs->group_util * imbalance_pct))
8477                 return true;
8478 
8479         if ((sgs->group_capacity * imbalance_pct) <
8480                         (sgs->group_runnable * 100))
8481                 return true;
8482 
8483         return false;
8484 }
8485 
8486 /*
8487  * group_smaller_min_cpu_capacity: Returns true if sched_group sg has smaller
8488  * per-CPU capacity than sched_group ref.
8489  */
8490 static inline bool
8491 group_smaller_min_cpu_capacity(struct sched_group *sg, struct sched_group *ref)
     /*   */
8492 {
8493         return fits_capacity(sg->sgc->min_capacity, ref->sgc->min_capacity);
8494 }
8495 
8496 /*
8497  * group_smaller_max_cpu_capacity: Returns true if sched_group sg has smaller
8498  * per-CPU capacity_orig than sched_group ref.
8499  */
8500 static inline bool
8501 group_smaller_max_cpu_capacity(struct sched_group *sg, struct sched_group *ref)
     /*   */
8502 {
8503         return fits_capacity(sg->sgc->max_capacity, ref->sgc->max_capacity);
8504 }
8505 
8506 static inline enum
8507 group_type group_classify(unsigned int imbalance_pct,
     /*   */
8508                           struct sched_group *group,
8509                           struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
8510 {
8511         if (group_is_overloaded(imbalance_pct, sgs))
8512                 return group_overloaded;
8513 
8514         if (sg_imbalanced(group))
8515                 return group_imbalanced;
8516 
8517         if (sgs->group_asym_packing)
8518                 return group_asym_packing;
8519 
8520         if (sgs->group_misfit_task_load)
8521                 return group_misfit_task;
8522 
8523         if (!group_has_capacity(imbalance_pct, sgs))
8524                 return group_fully_busy;
8525 
8526         return group_has_spare;
8527 }
8528 
8529 static bool update_nohz_stats(struct rq *rq, bool force)
     /*   */
8530 {
8531 #ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
8532         unsigned int cpu = rq->cpu;
8533 
8534         if (!rq->has_blocked_load)
8535                 return false;
8536 
8537         if (!cpumask_test_cpu(cpu, nohz.idle_cpus_mask))
8538                 return false;
8539 
8540         if (!force && !time_after(jiffies, rq->last_blocked_load_update_tick))
8541                 return true;
8542 
8543         update_blocked_averages(cpu);
8544 
8545         return rq->has_blocked_load;
8546 #else
8547         return false;
8548 #endif
8549 }
8550 
8551 /**
8552  * update_sg_lb_stats - Update sched_group's statistics for load balancing.
8553  * @env: The load balancing environment.
8554  * @group: sched_group whose statistics are to be updated.
8555  * @sgs: variable to hold the statistics for this group.
8556  * @sg_status: Holds flag indicating the status of the sched_group
8557  */
8558 static inline void update_sg_lb_stats(struct lb_env *env,
     /*   */
8559                                       struct sched_group *group,
8560                                       struct sg_lb_stats *sgs,
8561                                       int *sg_status)
8562 {
8563         int i, nr_running, local_group;
8564 
8565         memset(sgs, 0, sizeof(*sgs));
8566 
8567         local_group = cpumask_test_cpu(env->dst_cpu, sched_group_span(group));
8568 
8569         for_each_cpu_and(i, sched_group_span(group), env->cpus) {
8570                 struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(i);
8571 
8572                 if ((env->flags & LBF_NOHZ_STATS) && update_nohz_stats(rq, false))
8573                         env->flags |= LBF_NOHZ_AGAIN;
8574 
8575                 sgs->group_load += cpu_load(rq);
8576                 sgs->group_util += cpu_util(i);
8577                 sgs->group_runnable += cpu_runnable(rq);
8578                 sgs->sum_h_nr_running += rq->cfs.h_nr_running;
8579 
8580                 nr_running = rq->nr_running;
8581                 sgs->sum_nr_running += nr_running;
8582 
8583                 if (nr_running > 1)
8584                         *sg_status |= SG_OVERLOAD;
8585 
8586                 if (cpu_overutilized(i))
8587                         *sg_status |= SG_OVERUTILIZED;
8588 
8589 #ifdef CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING
8590                 sgs->nr_numa_running += rq->nr_numa_running;
8591                 sgs->nr_preferred_running += rq->nr_preferred_running;
8592 #endif
8593                 /*
8594                  * No need to call idle_cpu() if nr_running is not 0
8595                  */
8596                 if (!nr_running && idle_cpu(i)) {
8597                         sgs->idle_cpus++;
8598                         /* Idle cpu can't have misfit task */
8599                         continue;
8600                 }
8601 
8602                 if (local_group)
8603                         continue;
8604 
8605                 /* Check for a misfit task on the cpu */
8606                 if (env->sd->flags & SD_ASYM_CPUCAPACITY &&
8607                     sgs->group_misfit_task_load < rq->misfit_task_load) {
8608                         sgs->group_misfit_task_load = rq->misfit_task_load;
8609                         *sg_status |= SG_OVERLOAD;
8610                 }
8611         }
8612 
8613         /* Check if dst CPU is idle and preferred to this group */
8614         if (env->sd->flags & SD_ASYM_PACKING &&
8615             env->idle != CPU_NOT_IDLE &&
8616             sgs->sum_h_nr_running &&
8617             sched_asym_prefer(env->dst_cpu, group->asym_prefer_cpu)) {
8618                 sgs->group_asym_packing = 1;
8619         }
8620 
8621         sgs->group_capacity = group->sgc->capacity;
8622 
8623         sgs->group_weight = group->group_weight;
8624 
8625         sgs->group_type = group_classify(env->sd->imbalance_pct, group, sgs);
8626 
8627         /* Computing avg_load makes sense only when group is overloaded */
8628         if (sgs->group_type == group_overloaded)
8629                 sgs->avg_load = (sgs->group_load * SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE) /
8630                                 sgs->group_capacity;
8631 }
8632 
8633 /**
8634  * update_sd_pick_busiest - return 1 on busiest group
8635  * @env: The load balancing environment.
8636  * @sds: sched_domain statistics
8637  * @sg: sched_group candidate to be checked for being the busiest
8638  * @sgs: sched_group statistics
8639  *
8640  * Determine if @sg is a busier group than the previously selected
8641  * busiest group.
8642  *
8643  * Return: %true if @sg is a busier group than the previously selected
8644  * busiest group. %false otherwise.
8645  */
8646 static bool update_sd_pick_busiest(struct lb_env *env,
     /*   */
8647                                    struct sd_lb_stats *sds,
8648                                    struct sched_group *sg,
8649                                    struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
8650 {
8651         struct sg_lb_stats *busiest = &sds->busiest_stat;
8652 
8653         /* Make sure that there is at least one task to pull */
8654         if (!sgs->sum_h_nr_running)
8655                 return false;
8656 
8657         /*
8658          * Don't try to pull misfit tasks we can't help.
8659          * We can use max_capacity here as reduction in capacity on some
8660          * CPUs in the group should either be possible to resolve
8661          * internally or be covered by avg_load imbalance (eventually).
8662          */
8663         if (sgs->group_type == group_misfit_task &&
8664             (!group_smaller_max_cpu_capacity(sg, sds->local) ||
8665              sds->local_stat.group_type != group_has_spare))
8666                 return false;
8667 
8668         if (sgs->group_type > busiest->group_type)
8669                 return true;
8670 
8671         if (sgs->group_type < busiest->group_type)
8672                 return false;
8673 
8674         /*
8675          * The candidate and the current busiest group are the same type of
8676          * group. Let check which one is the busiest according to the type.
8677          */
8678 
8679         switch (sgs->group_type) {
8680         case group_overloaded:
8681                 /* Select the overloaded group with highest avg_load. */
8682                 if (sgs->avg_load <= busiest->avg_load)
8683                         return false;
8684                 break;
8685 
8686         case group_imbalanced:
8687                 /*
8688                  * Select the 1st imbalanced group as we don't have any way to
8689                  * choose one more than another.
8690                  */
8691                 return false;
8692 
8693         case group_asym_packing:
8694                 /* Prefer to move from lowest priority CPU's work */
8695                 if (sched_asym_prefer(sg->asym_prefer_cpu, sds->busiest->asym_prefer_cpu))
8696                         return false;
8697                 break;
8698 
8699         case group_misfit_task:
8700                 /*
8701                  * If we have more than one misfit sg go with the biggest
8702                  * misfit.
8703                  */
8704                 if (sgs->group_misfit_task_load < busiest->group_misfit_task_load)
8705                         return false;
8706                 break;
8707 
8708         case group_fully_busy:
8709                 /*
8710                  * Select the fully busy group with highest avg_load. In
8711                  * theory, there is no need to pull task from such kind of
8712                  * group because tasks have all compute capacity that they need
8713                  * but we can still improve the overall throughput by reducing
8714                  * contention when accessing shared HW resources.
8715                  *
8716                  * XXX for now avg_load is not computed and always 0 so we
8717                  * select the 1st one.
8718                  */
8719                 if (sgs->avg_load <= busiest->avg_load)
8720                         return false;
8721                 break;
8722 
8723         case group_has_spare:
8724                 /*
8725                  * Select not overloaded group with lowest number of idle cpus
8726                  * and highest number of running tasks. We could also compare
8727                  * the spare capacity which is more stable but it can end up
8728                  * that the group has less spare capacity but finally more idle
8729                  * CPUs which means less opportunity to pull tasks.
8730                  */
8731                 if (sgs->idle_cpus > busiest->idle_cpus)
8732                         return false;
8733                 else if ((sgs->idle_cpus == busiest->idle_cpus) &&
8734                          (sgs->sum_nr_running <= busiest->sum_nr_running))
8735                         return false;
8736 
8737                 break;
8738         }
8739 
8740         /*
8741          * Candidate sg has no more than one task per CPU and has higher
8742          * per-CPU capacity. Migrating tasks to less capable CPUs may harm
8743          * throughput. Maximize throughput, power/energy consequences are not
8744          * considered.
8745          */
8746         if ((env->sd->flags & SD_ASYM_CPUCAPACITY) &&
8747             (sgs->group_type <= group_fully_busy) &&
8748             (group_smaller_min_cpu_capacity(sds->local, sg)))
8749                 return false;
8750 
8751         return true;
8752 }
8753 
8754 #ifdef CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING
8755 static inline enum fbq_type fbq_classify_group(struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
     /*   */
8756 {
8757         if (sgs->sum_h_nr_running > sgs->nr_numa_running)
8758                 return regular;
8759         if (sgs->sum_h_nr_running > sgs->nr_preferred_running)
8760                 return remote;
8761         return all;
8762 }
8763 
8764 static inline enum fbq_type fbq_classify_rq(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
8765 {
8766         if (rq->nr_running > rq->nr_numa_running)
8767                 return regular;
8768         if (rq->nr_running > rq->nr_preferred_running)
8769                 return remote;
8770         return all;
8771 }
8772 #else
8773 static inline enum fbq_type fbq_classify_group(struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
     /*   */
8774 {
8775         return all;
8776 }
8777 
8778 static inline enum fbq_type fbq_classify_rq(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
8779 {
8780         return regular;
8781 }
8782 #endif /* CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING */
8783 
8784 
8785 struct sg_lb_stats;
8786 
8787 /*
8788  * task_running_on_cpu - return 1 if @p is running on @cpu.
8789  */
8790 
8791 static unsigned int task_running_on_cpu(int cpu, struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
8792 {
8793         /* Task has no contribution or is new */
8794         if (cpu != task_cpu(p) || !READ_ONCE(p->se.avg.last_update_time))
8795                 return 0;
8796 
8797         if (task_on_rq_queued(p))
8798                 return 1;
8799 
8800         return 0;
8801 }
8802 
8803 /**
8804  * idle_cpu_without - would a given CPU be idle without p ?
8805  * @cpu: the processor on which idleness is tested.
8806  * @p: task which should be ignored.
8807  *
8808  * Return: 1 if the CPU would be idle. 0 otherwise.
8809  */
8810 static int idle_cpu_without(int cpu, struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
8811 {
8812         struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
8813 
8814         if (rq->curr != rq->idle && rq->curr != p)
8815                 return 0;
8816 
8817         /*
8818          * rq->nr_running can't be used but an updated version without the
8819          * impact of p on cpu must be used instead. The updated nr_running
8820          * be computed and tested before calling idle_cpu_without().
8821          */
8822 
8823 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
8824         if (rq->ttwu_pending)
8825                 return 0;
8826 #endif
8827 
8828         return 1;
8829 }
8830 
8831 /*
8832  * update_sg_wakeup_stats - Update sched_group's statistics for wakeup.
8833  * @sd: The sched_domain level to look for idlest group.
8834  * @group: sched_group whose statistics are to be updated.
8835  * @sgs: variable to hold the statistics for this group.
8836  * @p: The task for which we look for the idlest group/CPU.
8837  */
8838 static inline void update_sg_wakeup_stats(struct sched_domain *sd,
     /*   */
8839                                           struct sched_group *group,
8840                                           struct sg_lb_stats *sgs,
8841                                           struct task_struct *p)
8842 {
8843         int i, nr_running;
8844 
8845         memset(sgs, 0, sizeof(*sgs));
8846 
8847         for_each_cpu(i, sched_group_span(group)) {
8848                 struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(i);
8849                 unsigned int local;
8850 
8851                 sgs->group_load += cpu_load_without(rq, p);
8852                 sgs->group_util += cpu_util_without(i, p);
8853                 sgs->group_runnable += cpu_runnable_without(rq, p);
8854                 local = task_running_on_cpu(i, p);
8855                 sgs->sum_h_nr_running += rq->cfs.h_nr_running - local;
8856 
8857                 nr_running = rq->nr_running - local;
8858                 sgs->sum_nr_running += nr_running;
8859 
8860                 /*
8861                  * No need to call idle_cpu_without() if nr_running is not 0
8862                  */
8863                 if (!nr_running && idle_cpu_without(i, p))
8864                         sgs->idle_cpus++;
8865 
8866         }
8867 
8868         /* Check if task fits in the group */
8869         if (sd->flags & SD_ASYM_CPUCAPACITY &&
8870             !task_fits_capacity(p, group->sgc->max_capacity)) {
8871                 sgs->group_misfit_task_load = 1;
8872         }
8873 
8874         sgs->group_capacity = group->sgc->capacity;
8875 
8876         sgs->group_weight = group->group_weight;
8877 
8878         sgs->group_type = group_classify(sd->imbalance_pct, group, sgs);
8879 
8880         /*
8881          * Computing avg_load makes sense only when group is fully busy or
8882          * overloaded
8883          */
8884         if (sgs->group_type == group_fully_busy ||
8885                 sgs->group_type == group_overloaded)
8886                 sgs->avg_load = (sgs->group_load * SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE) /
8887                                 sgs->group_capacity;
8888 }
8889 
8890 static bool update_pick_idlest(struct sched_group *idlest,
     /*   */
8891                                struct sg_lb_stats *idlest_sgs,
8892                                struct sched_group *group,
8893                                struct sg_lb_stats *sgs)
8894 {
8895         if (sgs->group_type < idlest_sgs->group_type)
8896                 return true;
8897 
8898         if (sgs->group_type > idlest_sgs->group_type)
8899                 return false;
8900 
8901         /*
8902          * The candidate and the current idlest group are the same type of
8903          * group. Let check which one is the idlest according to the type.
8904          */
8905 
8906         switch (sgs->group_type) {
8907         case group_overloaded:
8908         case group_fully_busy:
8909                 /* Select the group with lowest avg_load. */
8910                 if (idlest_sgs->avg_load <= sgs->avg_load)
8911                         return false;
8912                 break;
8913 
8914         case group_imbalanced:
8915         case group_asym_packing:
8916                 /* Those types are not used in the slow wakeup path */
8917                 return false;
8918 
8919         case group_misfit_task:
8920                 /* Select group with the highest max capacity */
8921                 if (idlest->sgc->max_capacity >= group->sgc->max_capacity)
8922                         return false;
8923                 break;
8924 
8925         case group_has_spare:
8926                 /* Select group with most idle CPUs */
8927                 if (idlest_sgs->idle_cpus > sgs->idle_cpus)
8928                         return false;
8929 
8930                 /* Select group with lowest group_util */
8931                 if (idlest_sgs->idle_cpus == sgs->idle_cpus &&
8932                         idlest_sgs->group_util <= sgs->group_util)
8933                         return false;
8934 
8935                 break;
8936         }
8937 
8938         return true;
8939 }
8940 
8941 /*
8942  * find_idlest_group() finds and returns the least busy CPU group within the
8943  * domain.
8944  *
8945  * Assumes p is allowed on at least one CPU in sd.
8946  */
8947 static struct sched_group *
8948 find_idlest_group(struct sched_domain *sd, struct task_struct *p, int this_cpu)
     /*   */
8949 {
8950         struct sched_group *idlest = NULL, *local = NULL, *group = sd->groups;
8951         struct sg_lb_stats local_sgs, tmp_sgs;
8952         struct sg_lb_stats *sgs;
8953         unsigned long imbalance;
8954         struct sg_lb_stats idlest_sgs = {
8955                         .avg_load = UINT_MAX,
8956                         .group_type = group_overloaded,
8957         };
8958 
8959         imbalance = scale_load_down(NICE_0_LOAD) *
8960                                 (sd->imbalance_pct-100) / 100;
8961 
8962         do {
8963                 int local_group;
8964 
8965                 /* Skip over this group if it has no CPUs allowed */
8966                 if (!cpumask_intersects(sched_group_span(group),
8967                                         p->cpus_ptr))
8968                         continue;
8969 
8970                 local_group = cpumask_test_cpu(this_cpu,
8971                                                sched_group_span(group));
8972 
8973                 if (local_group) {
8974                         sgs = &local_sgs;
8975                         local = group;
8976                 } else {
8977                         sgs = &tmp_sgs;
8978                 }
8979 
8980                 update_sg_wakeup_stats(sd, group, sgs, p);
8981 
8982                 if (!local_group && update_pick_idlest(idlest, &idlest_sgs, group, sgs)) {
8983                         idlest = group;
8984                         idlest_sgs = *sgs;
8985                 }
8986 
8987         } while (group = group->next, group != sd->groups);
8988 
8989 
8990         /* There is no idlest group to push tasks to */
8991         if (!idlest)
8992                 return NULL;
8993 
8994         /* The local group has been skipped because of CPU affinity */
8995         if (!local)
8996                 return idlest;
8997 
8998         /*
8999          * If the local group is idler than the selected idlest group
9000          * don't try and push the task.
9001          */
9002         if (local_sgs.group_type < idlest_sgs.group_type)
9003                 return NULL;
9004 
9005         /*
9006          * If the local group is busier than the selected idlest group
9007          * try and push the task.
9008          */
9009         if (local_sgs.group_type > idlest_sgs.group_type)
9010                 return idlest;
9011 
9012         switch (local_sgs.group_type) {
9013         case group_overloaded:
9014         case group_fully_busy:
9015                 /*
9016                  * When comparing groups across NUMA domains, it's possible for
9017                  * the local domain to be very lightly loaded relative to the
9018                  * remote domains but "imbalance" skews the comparison making
9019                  * remote CPUs look much more favourable. When considering
9020                  * cross-domain, add imbalance to the load on the remote node
9021                  * and consider staying local.
9022                  */
9023 
9024                 if ((sd->flags & SD_NUMA) &&
9025                     ((idlest_sgs.avg_load + imbalance) >= local_sgs.avg_load))
9026                         return NULL;
9027 
9028                 /*
9029                  * If the local group is less loaded than the selected
9030                  * idlest group don't try and push any tasks.
9031                  */
9032                 if (idlest_sgs.avg_load >= (local_sgs.avg_load + imbalance))
9033                         return NULL;
9034 
9035                 if (100 * local_sgs.avg_load <= sd->imbalance_pct * idlest_sgs.avg_load)
9036                         return NULL;
9037                 break;
9038 
9039         case group_imbalanced:
9040         case group_asym_packing:
9041                 /* Those type are not used in the slow wakeup path */
9042                 return NULL;
9043 
9044         case group_misfit_task:
9045                 /* Select group with the highest max capacity */
9046                 if (local->sgc->max_capacity >= idlest->sgc->max_capacity)
9047                         return NULL;
9048                 break;
9049 
9050         case group_has_spare:
9051                 if (sd->flags & SD_NUMA) {
9052 #ifdef CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING
9053                         int idlest_cpu;
9054                         /*
9055                          * If there is spare capacity at NUMA, try to select
9056                          * the preferred node
9057                          */
9058                         if (cpu_to_node(this_cpu) == p->numa_preferred_nid)
9059                                 return NULL;
9060 
9061                         idlest_cpu = cpumask_first(sched_group_span(idlest));
9062                         if (cpu_to_node(idlest_cpu) == p->numa_preferred_nid)
9063                                 return idlest;
9064 #endif
9065                         /*
9066                          * Otherwise, keep the task on this node to stay close
9067                          * its wakeup source and improve locality. If there is
9068                          * a real need of migration, periodic load balance will
9069                          * take care of it.
9070                          */
9071                         if (local_sgs.idle_cpus)
9072                                 return NULL;
9073                 }
9074 
9075                 /*
9076                  * Select group with highest number of idle CPUs. We could also
9077                  * compare the utilization which is more stable but it can end
9078                  * up that the group has less spare capacity but finally more
9079                  * idle CPUs which means more opportunity to run task.
9080                  */
9081                 if (local_sgs.idle_cpus >= idlest_sgs.idle_cpus)
9082                         return NULL;
9083                 break;
9084         }
9085 
9086         return idlest;
9087 }
9088 
9089 /**
9090  * update_sd_lb_stats - Update sched_domain's statistics for load balancing.
9091  * @env: The load balancing environment.
9092  * @sds: variable to hold the statistics for this sched_domain.
9093  */
9094 
9095 static inline void update_sd_lb_stats(struct lb_env *env, struct sd_lb_stats *sds)
     /*   */
9096 {
9097         struct sched_domain *child = env->sd->child;
9098         struct sched_group *sg = env->sd->groups;
9099         struct sg_lb_stats *local = &sds->local_stat;
9100         struct sg_lb_stats tmp_sgs;
9101         int sg_status = 0;
9102 
9103 #ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
9104         if (env->idle == CPU_NEWLY_IDLE && READ_ONCE(nohz.has_blocked))
9105                 env->flags |= LBF_NOHZ_STATS;
9106 #endif
9107 
9108         do {
9109                 struct sg_lb_stats *sgs = &tmp_sgs;
9110                 int local_group;
9111 
9112                 local_group = cpumask_test_cpu(env->dst_cpu, sched_group_span(sg));
9113                 if (local_group) {
9114                         sds->local = sg;
9115                         sgs = local;
9116 
9117                         if (env->idle != CPU_NEWLY_IDLE ||
9118                             time_after_eq(jiffies, sg->sgc->next_update))
9119                                 update_group_capacity(env->sd, env->dst_cpu);
9120                 }
9121 
9122                 update_sg_lb_stats(env, sg, sgs, &sg_status);
9123 
9124                 if (local_group)
9125                         goto next_group;
9126 
9127 
9128                 if (update_sd_pick_busiest(env, sds, sg, sgs)) {
9129                         sds->busiest = sg;
9130                         sds->busiest_stat = *sgs;
9131                 }
9132 
9133 next_group:
9134                 /* Now, start updating sd_lb_stats */
9135                 sds->total_load += sgs->group_load;
9136                 sds->total_capacity += sgs->group_capacity;
9137 
9138                 sg = sg->next;
9139         } while (sg != env->sd->groups);
9140 
9141         /* Tag domain that child domain prefers tasks go to siblings first */
9142         sds->prefer_sibling = child && child->flags & SD_PREFER_SIBLING;
9143 
9144 #ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
9145         if ((env->flags & LBF_NOHZ_AGAIN) &&
9146             cpumask_subset(nohz.idle_cpus_mask, sched_domain_span(env->sd))) {
9147 
9148                 WRITE_ONCE(nohz.next_blocked,
9149                            jiffies + msecs_to_jiffies(LOAD_AVG_PERIOD));
9150         }
9151 #endif
9152 
9153         if (env->sd->flags & SD_NUMA)
9154                 env->fbq_type = fbq_classify_group(&sds->busiest_stat);
9155 
9156         if (!env->sd->parent) {
9157                 struct root_domain *rd = env->dst_rq->rd;
9158 
9159                 /* update overload indicator if we are at root domain */
9160                 WRITE_ONCE(rd->overload, sg_status & SG_OVERLOAD);
9161 
9162                 /* Update over-utilization (tipping point, U >= 0) indicator */
9163                 WRITE_ONCE(rd->overutilized, sg_status & SG_OVERUTILIZED);
9164                 trace_sched_overutilized_tp(rd, sg_status & SG_OVERUTILIZED);
9165         } else if (sg_status & SG_OVERUTILIZED) {
9166                 struct root_domain *rd = env->dst_rq->rd;
9167 
9168                 WRITE_ONCE(rd->overutilized, SG_OVERUTILIZED);
9169                 trace_sched_overutilized_tp(rd, SG_OVERUTILIZED);
9170         }
9171 }
9172 
9173 static inline long adjust_numa_imbalance(int imbalance, int nr_running)
     /*   */
9174 {
9175         unsigned int imbalance_min;
9176 
9177         /*
9178          * Allow a small imbalance based on a simple pair of communicating
9179          * tasks that remain local when the source domain is almost idle.
9180          */
9181         imbalance_min = 2;
9182         if (nr_running <= imbalance_min)
9183                 return 0;
9184 
9185         return imbalance;
9186 }
9187 
9188 /**
9189  * calculate_imbalance - Calculate the amount of imbalance present within the
9190  *                       groups of a given sched_domain during load balance.
9191  * @env: load balance environment
9192  * @sds: statistics of the sched_domain whose imbalance is to be calculated.
9193  */
9194 static inline void calculate_imbalance(struct lb_env *env, struct sd_lb_stats *sds)
     /*   */
9195 {
9196         struct sg_lb_stats *local, *busiest;
9197 
9198         local = &sds->local_stat;
9199         busiest = &sds->busiest_stat;
9200 
9201         if (busiest->group_type == group_misfit_task) {
9202                 /* Set imbalance to allow misfit tasks to be balanced. */
9203                 env->migration_type = migrate_misfit;
9204                 env->imbalance = 1;
9205                 return;
9206         }
9207 
9208         if (busiest->group_type == group_asym_packing) {
9209                 /*
9210                  * In case of asym capacity, we will try to migrate all load to
9211                  * the preferred CPU.
9212                  */
9213                 env->migration_type = migrate_task;
9214                 env->imbalance = busiest->sum_h_nr_running;
9215                 return;
9216         }
9217 
9218         if (busiest->group_type == group_imbalanced) {
9219                 /*
9220                  * In the group_imb case we cannot rely on group-wide averages
9221                  * to ensure CPU-load equilibrium, try to move any task to fix
9222                  * the imbalance. The next load balance will take care of
9223                  * balancing back the system.
9224                  */
9225                 env->migration_type = migrate_task;
9226                 env->imbalance = 1;
9227                 return;
9228         }
9229 
9230         /*
9231          * Try to use spare capacity of local group without overloading it or
9232          * emptying busiest.
9233          */
9234         if (local->group_type == group_has_spare) {
9235                 if ((busiest->group_type > group_fully_busy) &&
9236                     !(env->sd->flags & SD_SHARE_PKG_RESOURCES)) {
9237                         /*
9238                          * If busiest is overloaded, try to fill spare
9239                          * capacity. This might end up creating spare capacity
9240                          * in busiest or busiest still being overloaded but
9241                          * there is no simple way to directly compute the
9242                          * amount of load to migrate in order to balance the
9243                          * system.
9244                          */
9245                         env->migration_type = migrate_util;
9246                         env->imbalance = max(local->group_capacity, local->group_util) -
9247                                          local->group_util;
9248 
9249                         /*
9250                          * In some cases, the group's utilization is max or even
9251                          * higher than capacity because of migrations but the
9252                          * local CPU is (newly) idle. There is at least one
9253                          * waiting task in this overloaded busiest group. Let's
9254                          * try to pull it.
9255                          */
9256                         if (env->idle != CPU_NOT_IDLE && env->imbalance == 0) {
9257                                 env->migration_type = migrate_task;
9258                                 env->imbalance = 1;
9259                         }
9260 
9261                         return;
9262                 }
9263 
9264                 if (busiest->group_weight == 1 || sds->prefer_sibling) {
9265                         unsigned int nr_diff = busiest->sum_nr_running;
9266                         /*
9267                          * When prefer sibling, evenly spread running tasks on
9268                          * groups.
9269                          */
9270                         env->migration_type = migrate_task;
9271                         lsub_positive(&nr_diff, local->sum_nr_running);
9272                         env->imbalance = nr_diff >> 1;
9273                 } else {
9274 
9275                         /*
9276                          * If there is no overload, we just want to even the number of
9277                          * idle cpus.
9278                          */
9279                         env->migration_type = migrate_task;
9280                         env->imbalance = max_t(long, 0, (local->idle_cpus -
9281                                                  busiest->idle_cpus) >> 1);
9282                 }
9283 
9284                 /* Consider allowing a small imbalance between NUMA groups */
9285                 if (env->sd->flags & SD_NUMA)
9286                         env->imbalance = adjust_numa_imbalance(env->imbalance,
9287                                                 busiest->sum_nr_running);
9288 
9289                 return;
9290         }
9291 
9292         /*
9293          * Local is fully busy but has to take more load to relieve the
9294          * busiest group
9295          */
9296         if (local->group_type < group_overloaded) {
9297                 /*
9298                  * Local will become overloaded so the avg_load metrics are
9299                  * finally needed.
9300                  */
9301 
9302                 local->avg_load = (local->group_load * SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE) /
9303                                   local->group_capacity;
9304 
9305                 sds->avg_load = (sds->total_load * SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE) /
9306                                 sds->total_capacity;
9307                 /*
9308                  * If the local group is more loaded than the selected
9309                  * busiest group don't try to pull any tasks.
9310                  */
9311                 if (local->avg_load >= busiest->avg_load) {
9312                         env->imbalance = 0;
9313                         return;
9314                 }
9315         }
9316 
9317         /*
9318          * Both group are or will become overloaded and we're trying to get all
9319          * the CPUs to the average_load, so we don't want to push ourselves
9320          * above the average load, nor do we wish to reduce the max loaded CPU
9321          * below the average load. At the same time, we also don't want to
9322          * reduce the group load below the group capacity. Thus we look for
9323          * the minimum possible imbalance.
9324          */
9325         env->migration_type = migrate_load;
9326         env->imbalance = min(
9327                 (busiest->avg_load - sds->avg_load) * busiest->group_capacity,
9328                 (sds->avg_load - local->avg_load) * local->group_capacity
9329         ) / SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE;
9330 }
9331 
9332 /******* find_busiest_group() helpers end here *********************/
9333 
9334 /*
9335  * Decision matrix according to the local and busiest group type:
9336  *
9337  * busiest \ local has_spare fully_busy misfit asym imbalanced overloaded
9338  * has_spare        nr_idle   balanced   N/A    N/A  balanced   balanced
9339  * fully_busy       nr_idle   nr_idle    N/A    N/A  balanced   balanced
9340  * misfit_task      force     N/A        N/A    N/A  force      force
9341  * asym_packing     force     force      N/A    N/A  force      force
9342  * imbalanced       force     force      N/A    N/A  force      force
9343  * overloaded       force     force      N/A    N/A  force      avg_load
9344  *
9345  * N/A :      Not Applicable because already filtered while updating
9346  *            statistics.
9347  * balanced : The system is balanced for these 2 groups.
9348  * force :    Calculate the imbalance as load migration is probably needed.
9349  * avg_load : Only if imbalance is significant enough.
9350  * nr_idle :  dst_cpu is not busy and the number of idle CPUs is quite
9351  *            different in groups.
9352  */
9353 
9354 /**
9355  * find_busiest_group - Returns the busiest group within the sched_domain
9356  * if there is an imbalance.
9357  *
9358  * Also calculates the amount of runnable load which should be moved
9359  * to restore balance.
9360  *
9361  * @env: The load balancing environment.
9362  *
9363  * Return:      - The busiest group if imbalance exists.
9364  */
9365 static struct sched_group *find_busiest_group(struct lb_env *env)
     /*   */
9366 {
9367         struct sg_lb_stats *local, *busiest;
9368         struct sd_lb_stats sds;
9369 
9370         init_sd_lb_stats(&sds);
9371 
9372         /*
9373          * Compute the various statistics relevant for load balancing at
9374          * this level.
9375          */
9376         update_sd_lb_stats(env, &sds);
9377 
9378         if (sched_energy_enabled()) {
9379                 struct root_domain *rd = env->dst_rq->rd;
9380                 int out_balance = 1;
9381 
9382                 trace_android_rvh_find_busiest_group(sds.busiest, env->dst_rq,
9383                                         &out_balance);
9384                 if (rcu_dereference(rd->pd) && !READ_ONCE(rd->overutilized)
9385                                         && out_balance)
9386                         goto out_balanced;
9387         }
9388 
9389         local = &sds.local_stat;
9390         busiest = &sds.busiest_stat;
9391 
9392         /* There is no busy sibling group to pull tasks from */
9393         if (!sds.busiest)
9394                 goto out_balanced;
9395 
9396         /* Misfit tasks should be dealt with regardless of the avg load */
9397         if (busiest->group_type == group_misfit_task)
9398                 goto force_balance;
9399 
9400         /* ASYM feature bypasses nice load balance check */
9401         if (busiest->group_type == group_asym_packing)
9402                 goto force_balance;
9403 
9404         /*
9405          * If the busiest group is imbalanced the below checks don't
9406          * work because they assume all things are equal, which typically
9407          * isn't true due to cpus_ptr constraints and the like.
9408          */
9409         if (busiest->group_type == group_imbalanced)
9410                 goto force_balance;
9411 
9412         /*
9413          * If the local group is busier than the selected busiest group
9414          * don't try and pull any tasks.
9415          */
9416         if (local->group_type > busiest->group_type)
9417                 goto out_balanced;
9418 
9419         /*
9420          * When groups are overloaded, use the avg_load to ensure fairness
9421          * between tasks.
9422          */
9423         if (local->group_type == group_overloaded) {
9424                 /*
9425                  * If the local group is more loaded than the selected
9426                  * busiest group don't try to pull any tasks.
9427                  */
9428                 if (local->avg_load >= busiest->avg_load)
9429                         goto out_balanced;
9430 
9431                 /* XXX broken for overlapping NUMA groups */
9432                 sds.avg_load = (sds.total_load * SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE) /
9433                                 sds.total_capacity;
9434 
9435                 /*
9436                  * Don't pull any tasks if this group is already above the
9437                  * domain average load.
9438                  */
9439                 if (local->avg_load >= sds.avg_load)
9440                         goto out_balanced;
9441 
9442                 /*
9443                  * If the busiest group is more loaded, use imbalance_pct to be
9444                  * conservative.
9445                  */
9446                 if (100 * busiest->avg_load <=
9447                                 env->sd->imbalance_pct * local->avg_load)
9448                         goto out_balanced;
9449         }
9450 
9451         /* Try to move all excess tasks to child's sibling domain */
9452         if (sds.prefer_sibling && local->group_type == group_has_spare &&
9453             busiest->sum_nr_running > local->sum_nr_running + 1)
9454                 goto force_balance;
9455 
9456         if (busiest->group_type != group_overloaded) {
9457                 if (env->idle == CPU_NOT_IDLE)
9458                         /*
9459                          * If the busiest group is not overloaded (and as a
9460                          * result the local one too) but this CPU is already
9461                          * busy, let another idle CPU try to pull task.
9462                          */
9463                         goto out_balanced;
9464 
9465                 if (busiest->group_weight > 1 &&
9466                     local->idle_cpus <= (busiest->idle_cpus + 1))
9467                         /*
9468                          * If the busiest group is not overloaded
9469                          * and there is no imbalance between this and busiest
9470                          * group wrt idle CPUs, it is balanced. The imbalance
9471                          * becomes significant if the diff is greater than 1
9472                          * otherwise we might end up to just move the imbalance
9473                          * on another group. Of course this applies only if
9474                          * there is more than 1 CPU per group.
9475                          */
9476                         goto out_balanced;
9477 
9478                 if (busiest->sum_h_nr_running == 1)
9479                         /*
9480                          * busiest doesn't have any tasks waiting to run
9481                          */
9482                         goto out_balanced;
9483         }
9484 
9485 force_balance:
9486         /* Looks like there is an imbalance. Compute it */
9487         calculate_imbalance(env, &sds);
9488         return env->imbalance ? sds.busiest : NULL;
9489 
9490 out_balanced:
9491         env->imbalance = 0;
9492         return NULL;
9493 }
9494 
9495 /*
9496  * find_busiest_queue - find the busiest runqueue among the CPUs in the group.
9497  */
9498 static struct rq *find_busiest_queue(struct lb_env *env,
     /*   */
9499                                      struct sched_group *group)
9500 {
9501         struct rq *busiest = NULL, *rq;
9502         unsigned long busiest_util = 0, busiest_load = 0, busiest_capacity = 1;
9503         unsigned int busiest_nr = 0;
9504         int i, done = 0;
9505 
9506         trace_android_rvh_find_busiest_queue(env->dst_cpu, group, env->cpus,
9507                                              &busiest, &done);
9508         if (done)
9509                 return busiest;
9510 
9511         for_each_cpu_and(i, sched_group_span(group), env->cpus) {
9512                 unsigned long capacity, load, util;
9513                 unsigned int nr_running;
9514                 enum fbq_type rt;
9515 
9516                 rq = cpu_rq(i);
9517                 rt = fbq_classify_rq(rq);
9518 
9519                 /*
9520                  * We classify groups/runqueues into three groups:
9521                  *  - regular: there are !numa tasks
9522                  *  - remote:  there are numa tasks that run on the 'wrong' node
9523                  *  - all:     there is no distinction
9524                  *
9525                  * In order to avoid migrating ideally placed numa tasks,
9526                  * ignore those when there's better options.
9527                  *
9528                  * If we ignore the actual busiest queue to migrate another
9529                  * task, the next balance pass can still reduce the busiest
9530                  * queue by moving tasks around inside the node.
9531                  *
9532                  * If we cannot move enough load due to this classification
9533                  * the next pass will adjust the group classification and
9534                  * allow migration of more tasks.
9535                  *
9536                  * Both cases only affect the total convergence complexity.
9537                  */
9538                 if (rt > env->fbq_type)
9539                         continue;
9540 
9541                 capacity = capacity_of(i);
9542                 nr_running = rq->cfs.h_nr_running;
9543 
9544                 /*
9545                  * For ASYM_CPUCAPACITY domains, don't pick a CPU that could
9546                  * eventually lead to active_balancing high->low capacity.
9547                  * Higher per-CPU capacity is considered better than balancing
9548                  * average load.
9549                  */
9550                 if (env->sd->flags & SD_ASYM_CPUCAPACITY &&
9551                     capacity_of(env->dst_cpu) < capacity &&
9552                     nr_running == 1)
9553                         continue;
9554 
9555                 switch (env->migration_type) {
9556                 case migrate_load:
9557                         /*
9558                          * When comparing with load imbalance, use cpu_load()
9559                          * which is not scaled with the CPU capacity.
9560                          */
9561                         load = cpu_load(rq);
9562 
9563                         if (nr_running == 1 && load > env->imbalance &&
9564                             !check_cpu_capacity(rq, env->sd))
9565                                 break;
9566 
9567                         /*
9568                          * For the load comparisons with the other CPUs,
9569                          * consider the cpu_load() scaled with the CPU
9570                          * capacity, so that the load can be moved away
9571                          * from the CPU that is potentially running at a
9572                          * lower capacity.
9573                          *
9574                          * Thus we're looking for max(load_i / capacity_i),
9575                          * crosswise multiplication to rid ourselves of the
9576                          * division works out to:
9577                          * load_i * capacity_j > load_j * capacity_i;
9578                          * where j is our previous maximum.
9579                          */
9580                         if (load * busiest_capacity > busiest_load * capacity) {
9581                                 busiest_load = load;
9582                                 busiest_capacity = capacity;
9583                                 busiest = rq;
9584                         }
9585                         break;
9586 
9587                 case migrate_util:
9588                         util = cpu_util(cpu_of(rq));
9589 
9590                         /*
9591                          * Don't try to pull utilization from a CPU with one
9592                          * running task. Whatever its utilization, we will fail
9593                          * detach the task.
9594                          */
9595                         if (nr_running <= 1)
9596                                 continue;
9597 
9598                         if (busiest_util < util) {
9599                                 busiest_util = util;
9600                                 busiest = rq;
9601                         }
9602                         break;
9603 
9604                 case migrate_task:
9605                         if (busiest_nr < nr_running) {
9606                                 busiest_nr = nr_running;
9607                                 busiest = rq;
9608                         }
9609                         break;
9610 
9611                 case migrate_misfit:
9612                         /*
9613                          * For ASYM_CPUCAPACITY domains with misfit tasks we
9614                          * simply seek the "biggest" misfit task.
9615                          */
9616                         if (rq->misfit_task_load > busiest_load) {
9617                                 busiest_load = rq->misfit_task_load;
9618                                 busiest = rq;
9619                         }
9620 
9621                         break;
9622 
9623                 }
9624         }
9625 
9626         return busiest;
9627 }
9628 
9629 /*
9630  * Max backoff if we encounter pinned tasks. Pretty arbitrary value, but
9631  * so long as it is large enough.
9632  */
9633 #define MAX_PINNED_INTERVAL     512
9634 
9635 static inline bool
9636 asym_active_balance(struct lb_env *env)
     /*   */
9637 {
9638         /*
9639          * ASYM_PACKING needs to force migrate tasks from busy but
9640          * lower priority CPUs in order to pack all tasks in the
9641          * highest priority CPUs.
9642          */
9643         return env->idle != CPU_NOT_IDLE && (env->sd->flags & SD_ASYM_PACKING) &&
9644                sched_asym_prefer(env->dst_cpu, env->src_cpu);
9645 }
9646 
9647 static inline bool
9648 voluntary_active_balance(struct lb_env *env)
     /*   */
9649 {
9650         struct sched_domain *sd = env->sd;
9651 
9652         if (asym_active_balance(env))
9653                 return 1;
9654 
9655         /*
9656          * The dst_cpu is idle and the src_cpu CPU has only 1 CFS task.
9657          * It's worth migrating the task if the src_cpu's capacity is reduced
9658          * because of other sched_class or IRQs if more capacity stays
9659          * available on dst_cpu.
9660          */
9661         if ((env->idle != CPU_NOT_IDLE) &&
9662             (env->src_rq->cfs.h_nr_running == 1)) {
9663                 if ((check_cpu_capacity(env->src_rq, sd)) &&
9664                     (capacity_of(env->src_cpu)*sd->imbalance_pct < capacity_of(env->dst_cpu)*100))
9665                         return 1;
9666         }
9667 
9668         if (env->migration_type == migrate_misfit)
9669                 return 1;
9670 
9671         return 0;
9672 }
9673 
9674 static int need_active_balance(struct lb_env *env)
     /*   */
9675 {
9676         struct sched_domain *sd = env->sd;
9677 
9678         if (voluntary_active_balance(env))
9679                 return 1;
9680 
9681         return unlikely(sd->nr_balance_failed > sd->cache_nice_tries+2);
9682 }
9683 
9684 static int active_load_balance_cpu_stop(void *data);
9685 
9686 static int should_we_balance(struct lb_env *env)
     /*   */
9687 {
9688         struct sched_group *sg = env->sd->groups;
9689         int cpu;
9690 
9691         /*
9692          * Ensure the balancing environment is consistent; can happen
9693          * when the softirq triggers 'during' hotplug.
9694          */
9695         if (!cpumask_test_cpu(env->dst_cpu, env->cpus))
9696                 return 0;
9697 
9698         /*
9699          * In the newly idle case, we will allow all the CPUs
9700          * to do the newly idle load balance.
9701          */
9702         if (env->idle == CPU_NEWLY_IDLE)
9703                 return 1;
9704 
9705         /* Try to find first idle CPU */
9706         for_each_cpu_and(cpu, group_balance_mask(sg), env->cpus) {
9707                 if (!idle_cpu(cpu))
9708                         continue;
9709 
9710                 /* Are we the first idle CPU? */
9711                 return cpu == env->dst_cpu;
9712         }
9713 
9714         /* Are we the first CPU of this group ? */
9715         return group_balance_cpu(sg) == env->dst_cpu;
9716 }
9717 
9718 /*
9719  * Check this_cpu to ensure it is balanced within domain. Attempt to move
9720  * tasks if there is an imbalance.
9721  */
9722 static int load_balance(int this_cpu, struct rq *this_rq,
     /*   */
9723                         struct sched_domain *sd, enum cpu_idle_type idle,
9724                         int *continue_balancing)
9725 {
9726         int ld_moved, cur_ld_moved, active_balance = 0;
9727         struct sched_domain *sd_parent = sd->parent;
9728         struct sched_group *group;
9729         struct rq *busiest;
9730         struct rq_flags rf;
9731         struct cpumask *cpus = this_cpu_cpumask_var_ptr(load_balance_mask);
9732 
9733         struct lb_env env = {
9734                 .sd             = sd,
9735                 .dst_cpu        = this_cpu,
9736                 .dst_rq         = this_rq,
9737                 .dst_grpmask    = sched_group_span(sd->groups),
9738                 .idle           = idle,
9739                 .loop_break     = sched_nr_migrate_break,
9740                 .cpus           = cpus,
9741                 .fbq_type       = all,
9742                 .tasks          = LIST_HEAD_INIT(env.tasks),
9743         };
9744 
9745         cpumask_and(cpus, sched_domain_span(sd), cpu_active_mask);
9746 
9747         schedstat_inc(sd->lb_count[idle]);
9748 
9749 redo:
9750         if (!should_we_balance(&env)) {
9751                 *continue_balancing = 0;
9752                 goto out_balanced;
9753         }
9754 
9755         group = find_busiest_group(&env);
9756         if (!group) {
9757                 schedstat_inc(sd->lb_nobusyg[idle]);
9758                 goto out_balanced;
9759         }
9760 
9761         busiest = find_busiest_queue(&env, group);
9762         if (!busiest) {
9763                 schedstat_inc(sd->lb_nobusyq[idle]);
9764                 goto out_balanced;
9765         }
9766 
9767         BUG_ON(busiest == env.dst_rq);
9768 
9769         schedstat_add(sd->lb_imbalance[idle], env.imbalance);
9770 
9771         env.src_cpu = busiest->cpu;
9772         env.src_rq = busiest;
9773 
9774         ld_moved = 0;
9775         if (busiest->nr_running > 1) {
9776                 /*
9777                  * Attempt to move tasks. If find_busiest_group has found
9778                  * an imbalance but busiest->nr_running <= 1, the group is
9779                  * still unbalanced. ld_moved simply stays zero, so it is
9780                  * correctly treated as an imbalance.
9781                  */
9782                 env.flags |= LBF_ALL_PINNED;
9783                 env.loop_max  = min(sysctl_sched_nr_migrate, busiest->nr_running);
9784 
9785 more_balance:
9786                 rq_lock_irqsave(busiest, &rf);
9787                 env.src_rq_rf = &rf;
9788                 update_rq_clock(busiest);
9789 
9790                 /*
9791                  * cur_ld_moved - load moved in current iteration
9792                  * ld_moved     - cumulative load moved across iterations
9793                  */
9794                 cur_ld_moved = detach_tasks(&env);
9795 
9796                 /*
9797                  * We've detached some tasks from busiest_rq. Every
9798                  * task is masked "TASK_ON_RQ_MIGRATING", so we can safely
9799                  * unlock busiest->lock, and we are able to be sure
9800                  * that nobody can manipulate the tasks in parallel.
9801                  * See task_rq_lock() family for the details.
9802                  */
9803 
9804                 rq_unlock(busiest, &rf);
9805 
9806                 if (cur_ld_moved) {
9807                         attach_tasks(&env);
9808                         ld_moved += cur_ld_moved;
9809                 }
9810 
9811                 local_irq_restore(rf.flags);
9812 
9813                 if (env.flags & LBF_NEED_BREAK) {
9814                         env.flags &= ~LBF_NEED_BREAK;
9815                         goto more_balance;
9816                 }
9817 
9818                 /*
9819                  * Revisit (affine) tasks on src_cpu that couldn't be moved to
9820                  * us and move them to an alternate dst_cpu in our sched_group
9821                  * where they can run. The upper limit on how many times we
9822                  * iterate on same src_cpu is dependent on number of CPUs in our
9823                  * sched_group.
9824                  *
9825                  * This changes load balance semantics a bit on who can move
9826                  * load to a given_cpu. In addition to the given_cpu itself
9827                  * (or a ilb_cpu acting on its behalf where given_cpu is
9828                  * nohz-idle), we now have balance_cpu in a position to move
9829                  * load to given_cpu. In rare situations, this may cause
9830                  * conflicts (balance_cpu and given_cpu/ilb_cpu deciding
9831                  * _independently_ and at _same_ time to move some load to
9832                  * given_cpu) causing exceess load to be moved to given_cpu.
9833                  * This however should not happen so much in practice and
9834                  * moreover subsequent load balance cycles should correct the
9835                  * excess load moved.
9836                  */
9837                 if ((env.flags & LBF_DST_PINNED) && env.imbalance > 0) {
9838 
9839                         /* Prevent to re-select dst_cpu via env's CPUs */
9840                         __cpumask_clear_cpu(env.dst_cpu, env.cpus);
9841 
9842                         env.dst_rq       = cpu_rq(env.new_dst_cpu);
9843                         env.dst_cpu      = env.new_dst_cpu;
9844                         env.flags       &= ~LBF_DST_PINNED;
9845                         env.loop         = 0;
9846                         env.loop_break   = sched_nr_migrate_break;
9847 
9848                         /*
9849                          * Go back to "more_balance" rather than "redo" since we
9850                          * need to continue with same src_cpu.
9851                          */
9852                         goto more_balance;
9853                 }
9854 
9855                 /*
9856                  * We failed to reach balance because of affinity.
9857                  */
9858                 if (sd_parent) {
9859                         int *group_imbalance = &sd_parent->groups->sgc->imbalance;
9860 
9861                         if ((env.flags & LBF_SOME_PINNED) && env.imbalance > 0)
9862                                 *group_imbalance = 1;
9863                 }
9864 
9865                 /* All tasks on this runqueue were pinned by CPU affinity */
9866                 if (unlikely(env.flags & LBF_ALL_PINNED)) {
9867                         __cpumask_clear_cpu(cpu_of(busiest), cpus);
9868                         /*
9869                          * Attempting to continue load balancing at the current
9870                          * sched_domain level only makes sense if there are
9871                          * active CPUs remaining as possible busiest CPUs to
9872                          * pull load from which are not contained within the
9873                          * destination group that is receiving any migrated
9874                          * load.
9875                          */
9876                         if (!cpumask_subset(cpus, env.dst_grpmask)) {
9877                                 env.loop = 0;
9878                                 env.loop_break = sched_nr_migrate_break;
9879                                 goto redo;
9880                         }
9881                         goto out_all_pinned;
9882                 }
9883         }
9884 
9885         if (!ld_moved) {
9886                 schedstat_inc(sd->lb_failed[idle]);
9887                 /*
9888                  * Increment the failure counter only on periodic balance.
9889                  * We do not want newidle balance, which can be very
9890                  * frequent, pollute the failure counter causing
9891                  * excessive cache_hot migrations and active balances.
9892                  */
9893                 if (idle != CPU_NEWLY_IDLE)
9894                         sd->nr_balance_failed++;
9895 
9896                 if (need_active_balance(&env)) {
9897                         unsigned long flags;
9898 
9899                         raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&busiest->lock, flags);
9900 
9901                         /*
9902                          * Don't kick the active_load_balance_cpu_stop,
9903                          * if the curr task on busiest CPU can't be
9904                          * moved to this_cpu:
9905                          */
9906                         if (!cpumask_test_cpu(this_cpu, busiest->curr->cpus_ptr)) {
9907                                 raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&busiest->lock,
9908                                                             flags);
9909                                 env.flags |= LBF_ALL_PINNED;
9910                                 goto out_one_pinned;
9911                         }
9912 
9913                         /*
9914                          * ->active_balance synchronizes accesses to
9915                          * ->active_balance_work.  Once set, it's cleared
9916                          * only after active load balance is finished.
9917                          */
9918                         if (!busiest->active_balance) {
9919                                 busiest->active_balance = 1;
9920                                 busiest->push_cpu = this_cpu;
9921                                 active_balance = 1;
9922                         }
9923                         raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&busiest->lock, flags);
9924 
9925                         if (active_balance) {
9926                                 stop_one_cpu_nowait(cpu_of(busiest),
9927                                         active_load_balance_cpu_stop, busiest,
9928                                         &busiest->active_balance_work);
9929                         }
9930 
9931                         /* We've kicked active balancing, force task migration. */
9932                         sd->nr_balance_failed = sd->cache_nice_tries+1;
9933                 }
9934         } else
9935                 sd->nr_balance_failed = 0;
9936 
9937         if (likely(!active_balance) || voluntary_active_balance(&env)) {
9938                 /* We were unbalanced, so reset the balancing interval */
9939                 sd->balance_interval = sd->min_interval;
9940         } else {
9941                 /*
9942                  * If we've begun active balancing, start to back off. This
9943                  * case may not be covered by the all_pinned logic if there
9944                  * is only 1 task on the busy runqueue (because we don't call
9945                  * detach_tasks).
9946                  */
9947                 if (sd->balance_interval < sd->max_interval)
9948                         sd->balance_interval *= 2;
9949         }
9950 
9951         goto out;
9952 
9953 out_balanced:
9954         /*
9955          * We reach balance although we may have faced some affinity
9956          * constraints. Clear the imbalance flag only if other tasks got
9957          * a chance to move and fix the imbalance.
9958          */
9959         if (sd_parent && !(env.flags & LBF_ALL_PINNED)) {
9960                 int *group_imbalance = &sd_parent->groups->sgc->imbalance;
9961 
9962                 if (*group_imbalance)
9963                         *group_imbalance = 0;
9964         }
9965 
9966 out_all_pinned:
9967         /*
9968          * We reach balance because all tasks are pinned at this level so
9969          * we can't migrate them. Let the imbalance flag set so parent level
9970          * can try to migrate them.
9971          */
9972         schedstat_inc(sd->lb_balanced[idle]);
9973 
9974         sd->nr_balance_failed = 0;
9975 
9976 out_one_pinned:
9977         ld_moved = 0;
9978 
9979         /*
9980          * newidle_balance() disregards balance intervals, so we could
9981          * repeatedly reach this code, which would lead to balance_interval
9982          * skyrocketting in a short amount of time. Skip the balance_interval
9983          * increase logic to avoid that.
9984          */
9985         if (env.idle == CPU_NEWLY_IDLE)
9986                 goto out;
9987 
9988         /* tune up the balancing interval */
9989         if ((env.flags & LBF_ALL_PINNED &&
9990              sd->balance_interval < MAX_PINNED_INTERVAL) ||
9991             sd->balance_interval < sd->max_interval)
9992                 sd->balance_interval *= 2;
9993 out:
9994         return ld_moved;
9995 }
9996 
9997 static inline unsigned long
9998 get_sd_balance_interval(struct sched_domain *sd, int cpu_busy)
     /*   */
9999 {
10000         unsigned long interval = sd->balance_interval;
10001 
10002         if (cpu_busy)
10003                 interval *= sd->busy_factor;
10004 
10005         /* scale ms to jiffies */
10006         interval = msecs_to_jiffies(interval);
10007 
10008         /*
10009          * Reduce likelihood of busy balancing at higher domains racing with
10010          * balancing at lower domains by preventing their balancing periods
10011          * from being multiples of each other.
10012          */
10013         if (cpu_busy)
10014                 interval -= 1;
10015 
10016         interval = clamp(interval, 1UL, max_load_balance_interval);
10017 
10018         return interval;
10019 }
10020 
10021 static inline void
10022 update_next_balance(struct sched_domain *sd, unsigned long *next_balance)
     /*   */
10023 {
10024         unsigned long interval, next;
10025 
10026         /* used by idle balance, so cpu_busy = 0 */
10027         interval = get_sd_balance_interval(sd, 0);
10028         next = sd->last_balance + interval;
10029 
10030         if (time_after(*next_balance, next))
10031                 *next_balance = next;
10032 }
10033 
10034 /*
10035  * active_load_balance_cpu_stop is run by the CPU stopper. It pushes
10036  * running tasks off the busiest CPU onto idle CPUs. It requires at
10037  * least 1 task to be running on each physical CPU where possible, and
10038  * avoids physical / logical imbalances.
10039  */
10040 static int active_load_balance_cpu_stop(void *data)
     /*   */
10041 {
10042         struct rq *busiest_rq = data;
10043         int busiest_cpu = cpu_of(busiest_rq);
10044         int target_cpu = busiest_rq->push_cpu;
10045         struct rq *target_rq = cpu_rq(target_cpu);
10046         struct sched_domain *sd;
10047         struct task_struct *p = NULL;
10048         struct rq_flags rf;
10049 
10050         rq_lock_irq(busiest_rq, &rf);
10051         /*
10052          * Between queueing the stop-work and running it is a hole in which
10053          * CPUs can become inactive. We should not move tasks from or to
10054          * inactive CPUs.
10055          */
10056         if (!cpu_active(busiest_cpu) || !cpu_active(target_cpu))
10057                 goto out_unlock;
10058 
10059         /* Make sure the requested CPU hasn't gone down in the meantime: */
10060         if (unlikely(busiest_cpu != smp_processor_id() ||
10061                      !busiest_rq->active_balance))
10062                 goto out_unlock;
10063 
10064         /* Is there any task to move? */
10065         if (busiest_rq->nr_running <= 1)
10066                 goto out_unlock;
10067 
10068         /*
10069          * This condition is "impossible", if it occurs
10070          * we need to fix it. Originally reported by
10071          * Bjorn Helgaas on a 128-CPU setup.
10072          */
10073         BUG_ON(busiest_rq == target_rq);
10074 
10075         /* Search for an sd spanning us and the target CPU. */
10076         rcu_read_lock();
10077         for_each_domain(target_cpu, sd) {
10078                 if (cpumask_test_cpu(busiest_cpu, sched_domain_span(sd)))
10079                         break;
10080         }
10081
