10082         if (likely(sd)) {
10083                 struct lb_env env = {
10084                         .sd             = sd,
10085                         .dst_cpu        = target_cpu,
10086                         .dst_rq         = target_rq,
10087                         .src_cpu        = busiest_rq->cpu,
10088                         .src_rq         = busiest_rq,
10089                         .idle           = CPU_IDLE,
10090                         /*
10091                          * can_migrate_task() doesn't need to compute new_dst_cpu
10092                          * for active balancing. Since we have CPU_IDLE, but no
10093                          * @dst_grpmask we need to make that test go away with lying
10094                          * about DST_PINNED.
10095                          */
10096                         .flags          = LBF_DST_PINNED,
10097                         .src_rq_rf      = &rf,
10098                 };
10099 
10100                 schedstat_inc(sd->alb_count);
10101                 update_rq_clock(busiest_rq);
10102 
10103                 p = detach_one_task(&env);
10104                 if (p) {
10105                         schedstat_inc(sd->alb_pushed);
10106                         /* Active balancing done, reset the failure counter. */
10107                         sd->nr_balance_failed = 0;
10108                 } else {
10109                         schedstat_inc(sd->alb_failed);
10110                 }
10111         }
10112         rcu_read_unlock();
10113 out_unlock:
10114         busiest_rq->active_balance = 0;
10115         rq_unlock(busiest_rq, &rf);
10116 
10117         if (p)
10118                 attach_one_task(target_rq, p);
10119 
10120         local_irq_enable();
10121 
10122         return 0;
10123 }
10124 
10125 static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(balancing);
10126 
10127 /*
10128  * Scale the max load_balance interval with the number of CPUs in the system.
10129  * This trades load-balance latency on larger machines for less cross talk.
10130  */
10131 void update_max_interval(void)
     /*   */
10132 {
10133         max_load_balance_interval = HZ*num_active_cpus()/10;
10134 }
10135 
10136 /*
10137  * It checks each scheduling domain to see if it is due to be balanced,
10138  * and initiates a balancing operation if so.
10139  *
10140  * Balancing parameters are set up in init_sched_domains.
10141  */
10142 static void rebalance_domains(struct rq *rq, enum cpu_idle_type idle)
     /*   */
10143 {
10144         int continue_balancing = 1;
10145         int cpu = rq->cpu;
10146         int busy = idle != CPU_IDLE && !sched_idle_cpu(cpu);
10147         unsigned long interval;
10148         struct sched_domain *sd;
10149         /* Earliest time when we have to do rebalance again */
10150         unsigned long next_balance = jiffies + 60*HZ;
10151         int update_next_balance = 0;
10152         int need_serialize, need_decay = 0;
10153         u64 max_cost = 0;
10154 
10155         trace_android_rvh_sched_rebalance_domains(rq, &continue_balancing);
10156         if (!continue_balancing)
10157                 return;
10158 
10159         rcu_read_lock();
10160         for_each_domain(cpu, sd) {
10161                 /*
10162                  * Decay the newidle max times here because this is a regular
10163                  * visit to all the domains. Decay ~1% per second.
10164                  */
10165                 if (time_after(jiffies, sd->next_decay_max_lb_cost)) {
10166                         sd->max_newidle_lb_cost =
10167                                 (sd->max_newidle_lb_cost * 253) / 256;
10168                         sd->next_decay_max_lb_cost = jiffies + HZ;
10169                         need_decay = 1;
10170                 }
10171                 max_cost += sd->max_newidle_lb_cost;
10172 
10173                 /*
10174                  * Stop the load balance at this level. There is another
10175                  * CPU in our sched group which is doing load balancing more
10176                  * actively.
10177                  */
10178                 if (!continue_balancing) {
10179                         if (need_decay)
10180                                 continue;
10181                         break;
10182                 }
10183 
10184                 interval = get_sd_balance_interval(sd, busy);
10185 
10186                 need_serialize = sd->flags & SD_SERIALIZE;
10187                 if (need_serialize) {
10188                         if (!spin_trylock(&balancing))
10189                                 goto out;
10190                 }
10191 
10192                 if (time_after_eq(jiffies, sd->last_balance + interval)) {
10193                         if (load_balance(cpu, rq, sd, idle, &continue_balancing)) {
10194                                 /*
10195                                  * The LBF_DST_PINNED logic could have changed
10196                                  * env->dst_cpu, so we can't know our idle
10197                                  * state even if we migrated tasks. Update it.
10198                                  */
10199                                 idle = idle_cpu(cpu) ? CPU_IDLE : CPU_NOT_IDLE;
10200                                 busy = idle != CPU_IDLE && !sched_idle_cpu(cpu);
10201                         }
10202                         sd->last_balance = jiffies;
10203                         interval = get_sd_balance_interval(sd, busy);
10204                 }
10205                 if (need_serialize)
10206                         spin_unlock(&balancing);
10207 out:
10208                 if (time_after(next_balance, sd->last_balance + interval)) {
10209                         next_balance = sd->last_balance + interval;
10210                         update_next_balance = 1;
10211                 }
10212         }
10213         if (need_decay) {
10214                 /*
10215                  * Ensure the rq-wide value also decays but keep it at a
10216                  * reasonable floor to avoid funnies with rq->avg_idle.
10217                  */
10218                 rq->max_idle_balance_cost =
10219                         max((u64)sysctl_sched_migration_cost, max_cost);
10220         }
10221         rcu_read_unlock();
10222 
10223         /*
10224          * next_balance will be updated only when there is a need.
10225          * When the cpu is attached to null domain for ex, it will not be
10226          * updated.
10227          */
10228         if (likely(update_next_balance)) {
10229                 rq->next_balance = next_balance;
10230 
10231 #ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
10232                 /*
10233                  * If this CPU has been elected to perform the nohz idle
10234                  * balance. Other idle CPUs have already rebalanced with
10235                  * nohz_idle_balance() and nohz.next_balance has been
10236                  * updated accordingly. This CPU is now running the idle load
10237                  * balance for itself and we need to update the
10238                  * nohz.next_balance accordingly.
10239                  */
10240                 if ((idle == CPU_IDLE) && time_after(nohz.next_balance, rq->next_balance))
10241                         nohz.next_balance = rq->next_balance;
10242 #endif
10243         }
10244 }
10245 
10246 static inline int on_null_domain(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
10247 {
10248         return unlikely(!rcu_dereference_sched(rq->sd));
10249 }
10250 
10251 #ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
10252 /*
10253  * idle load balancing details
10254  * - When one of the busy CPUs notice that there may be an idle rebalancing
10255  *   needed, they will kick the idle load balancer, which then does idle
10256  *   load balancing for all the idle CPUs.
10257  * - HK_FLAG_MISC CPUs are used for this task, because HK_FLAG_SCHED not set
10258  *   anywhere yet.
10259  */
10260 
10261 static inline int find_new_ilb(void)
     /*   */
10262 {
10263         int ilb = -1;
10264 
10265         trace_android_rvh_find_new_ilb(nohz.idle_cpus_mask, &ilb);
10266         if (ilb >= 0)
10267                 return ilb;
10268 
10269         for_each_cpu_and(ilb, nohz.idle_cpus_mask,
10270                               housekeeping_cpumask(HK_FLAG_MISC)) {
10271                 if (idle_cpu(ilb))
10272                         return ilb;
10273         }
10274 
10275         return nr_cpu_ids;
10276 }
10277 
10278 /*
10279  * Kick a CPU to do the nohz balancing, if it is time for it. We pick any
10280  * idle CPU in the HK_FLAG_MISC housekeeping set (if there is one).
10281  */
10282 static void kick_ilb(unsigned int flags)
     /*   */
10283 {
10284         int ilb_cpu;
10285 
10286         /*
10287          * Increase nohz.next_balance only when if full ilb is triggered but
10288          * not if we only update stats.
10289          */
10290         if (flags & NOHZ_BALANCE_KICK)
10291                 nohz.next_balance = jiffies+1;
10292 
10293         ilb_cpu = find_new_ilb();
10294 
10295         if (ilb_cpu >= nr_cpu_ids)
10296                 return;
10297 
10298         /*
10299          * Access to rq::nohz_csd is serialized by NOHZ_KICK_MASK; he who sets
10300          * the first flag owns it; cleared by nohz_csd_func().
10301          */
10302         flags = atomic_fetch_or(flags, nohz_flags(ilb_cpu));
10303         if (flags & NOHZ_KICK_MASK)
10304                 return;
10305 
10306         /*
10307          * This way we generate an IPI on the target CPU which
10308          * is idle. And the softirq performing nohz idle load balance
10309          * will be run before returning from the IPI.
10310          */
10311         smp_call_function_single_async(ilb_cpu, &cpu_rq(ilb_cpu)->nohz_csd);
10312 }
10313 
10314 /*
10315  * Current decision point for kicking the idle load balancer in the presence
10316  * of idle CPUs in the system.
10317  */
10318 static void nohz_balancer_kick(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
10319 {
10320         unsigned long now = jiffies;
10321         struct sched_domain_shared *sds;
10322         struct sched_domain *sd;
10323         int nr_busy, i, cpu = rq->cpu;
10324         unsigned int flags = 0;
10325         int done = 0;
10326 
10327         if (unlikely(rq->idle_balance))
10328                 return;
10329 
10330         /*
10331          * We may be recently in ticked or tickless idle mode. At the first
10332          * busy tick after returning from idle, we will update the busy stats.
10333          */
10334         nohz_balance_exit_idle(rq);
10335 
10336         /*
10337          * None are in tickless mode and hence no need for NOHZ idle load
10338          * balancing.
10339          */
10340         if (likely(!atomic_read(&nohz.nr_cpus)))
10341                 return;
10342 
10343         if (READ_ONCE(nohz.has_blocked) &&
10344             time_after(now, READ_ONCE(nohz.next_blocked)))
10345                 flags = NOHZ_STATS_KICK;
10346 
10347         if (time_before(now, nohz.next_balance))
10348                 goto out;
10349 
10350         trace_android_rvh_sched_nohz_balancer_kick(rq, &flags, &done);
10351         if (done)
10352                 goto out;
10353 
10354         if (rq->nr_running >= 2) {
10355                 flags = NOHZ_KICK_MASK;
10356                 goto out;
10357         }
10358 
10359         rcu_read_lock();
10360 
10361         sd = rcu_dereference(rq->sd);
10362         if (sd) {
10363                 /*
10364                  * If there's a CFS task and the current CPU has reduced
10365                  * capacity; kick the ILB to see if there's a better CPU to run
10366                  * on.
10367                  */
10368                 if (rq->cfs.h_nr_running >= 1 && check_cpu_capacity(rq, sd)) {
10369                         flags = NOHZ_KICK_MASK;
10370                         goto unlock;
10371                 }
10372         }
10373 
10374         sd = rcu_dereference(per_cpu(sd_asym_packing, cpu));
10375         if (sd) {
10376                 /*
10377                  * When ASYM_PACKING; see if there's a more preferred CPU
10378                  * currently idle; in which case, kick the ILB to move tasks
10379                  * around.
10380                  */
10381                 for_each_cpu_and(i, sched_domain_span(sd), nohz.idle_cpus_mask) {
10382                         if (sched_asym_prefer(i, cpu)) {
10383                                 flags = NOHZ_KICK_MASK;
10384                                 goto unlock;
10385                         }
10386                 }
10387         }
10388 
10389         sd = rcu_dereference(per_cpu(sd_asym_cpucapacity, cpu));
10390         if (sd) {
10391                 /*
10392                  * When ASYM_CPUCAPACITY; see if there's a higher capacity CPU
10393                  * to run the misfit task on.
10394                  */
10395                 if (check_misfit_status(rq, sd)) {
10396                         flags = NOHZ_KICK_MASK;
10397                         goto unlock;
10398                 }
10399 
10400                 /*
10401                  * For asymmetric systems, we do not want to nicely balance
10402                  * cache use, instead we want to embrace asymmetry and only
10403                  * ensure tasks have enough CPU capacity.
10404                  *
10405                  * Skip the LLC logic because it's not relevant in that case.
10406                  */
10407                 goto unlock;
10408         }
10409 
10410         sds = rcu_dereference(per_cpu(sd_llc_shared, cpu));
10411         if (sds) {
10412                 /*
10413                  * If there is an imbalance between LLC domains (IOW we could
10414                  * increase the overall cache use), we need some less-loaded LLC
10415                  * domain to pull some load. Likewise, we may need to spread
10416                  * load within the current LLC domain (e.g. packed SMT cores but
10417                  * other CPUs are idle). We can't really know from here how busy
10418                  * the others are - so just get a nohz balance going if it looks
10419                  * like this LLC domain has tasks we could move.
10420                  */
10421                 nr_busy = atomic_read(&sds->nr_busy_cpus);
10422                 if (nr_busy > 1) {
10423                         flags = NOHZ_KICK_MASK;
10424                         goto unlock;
10425                 }
10426         }
10427 unlock:
10428         rcu_read_unlock();
10429 out:
10430         if (flags)
10431                 kick_ilb(flags);
10432 }
10433 
10434 static void set_cpu_sd_state_busy(int cpu)
     /*   */
10435 {
10436         struct sched_domain *sd;
10437 
10438         rcu_read_lock();
10439         sd = rcu_dereference(per_cpu(sd_llc, cpu));
10440 
10441         if (!sd || !sd->nohz_idle)
10442                 goto unlock;
10443         sd->nohz_idle = 0;
10444 
10445         atomic_inc(&sd->shared->nr_busy_cpus);
10446 unlock:
10447         rcu_read_unlock();
10448 }
10449 
10450 void nohz_balance_exit_idle(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
10451 {
10452         SCHED_WARN_ON(rq != this_rq());
10453 
10454         if (likely(!rq->nohz_tick_stopped))
10455                 return;
10456 
10457         rq->nohz_tick_stopped = 0;
10458         cpumask_clear_cpu(rq->cpu, nohz.idle_cpus_mask);
10459         atomic_dec(&nohz.nr_cpus);
10460 
10461         set_cpu_sd_state_busy(rq->cpu);
10462 }
10463 
10464 static void set_cpu_sd_state_idle(int cpu)
     /*   */
10465 {
10466         struct sched_domain *sd;
10467 
10468         rcu_read_lock();
10469         sd = rcu_dereference(per_cpu(sd_llc, cpu));
10470 
10471         if (!sd || sd->nohz_idle)
10472                 goto unlock;
10473         sd->nohz_idle = 1;
10474 
10475         atomic_dec(&sd->shared->nr_busy_cpus);
10476 unlock:
10477         rcu_read_unlock();
10478 }
10479 
10480 /*
10481  * This routine will record that the CPU is going idle with tick stopped.
10482  * This info will be used in performing idle load balancing in the future.
10483  */
10484 void nohz_balance_enter_idle(int cpu)
     /*   */
10485 {
10486         struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
10487 
10488         SCHED_WARN_ON(cpu != smp_processor_id());
10489 
10490         if (!cpu_active(cpu)) {
10491                 /*
10492                  * A CPU can be paused while it is idle with it's tick
10493                  * stopped. nohz_balance_exit_idle() should be called
10494                  * from the local CPU, so it can't be called during
10495                  * pause. This results in paused CPU participating in
10496                  * the nohz idle balance, which should be avoided.
10497                  *
10498                  * When the paused CPU exits idle and enters again,
10499                  * exempt the paused CPU from nohz_balance_exit_idle.
10500                  */
10501                 nohz_balance_exit_idle(rq);
10502                 return;
10503         }
10504 
10505         /* Spare idle load balancing on CPUs that don't want to be disturbed: */
10506         if (!housekeeping_cpu(cpu, HK_FLAG_SCHED))
10507                 return;
10508 
10509         /*
10510          * Can be set safely without rq->lock held
10511          * If a clear happens, it will have evaluated last additions because
10512          * rq->lock is held during the check and the clear
10513          */
10514         rq->has_blocked_load = 1;
10515 
10516         /*
10517          * The tick is still stopped but load could have been added in the
10518          * meantime. We set the nohz.has_blocked flag to trig a check of the
10519          * *_avg. The CPU is already part of nohz.idle_cpus_mask so the clear
10520          * of nohz.has_blocked can only happen after checking the new load
10521          */
10522         if (rq->nohz_tick_stopped)
10523                 goto out;
10524 
10525         /* If we're a completely isolated CPU, we don't play: */
10526         if (on_null_domain(rq))
10527                 return;
10528 
10529         rq->nohz_tick_stopped = 1;
10530 
10531         cpumask_set_cpu(cpu, nohz.idle_cpus_mask);
10532         atomic_inc(&nohz.nr_cpus);
10533 
10534         /*
10535          * Ensures that if nohz_idle_balance() fails to observe our
10536          * @idle_cpus_mask store, it must observe the @has_blocked
10537          * store.
10538          */
10539         smp_mb__after_atomic();
10540 
10541         set_cpu_sd_state_idle(cpu);
10542 
10543 out:
10544         /*
10545          * Each time a cpu enter idle, we assume that it has blocked load and
10546          * enable the periodic update of the load of idle cpus
10547          */
10548         WRITE_ONCE(nohz.has_blocked, 1);
10549 }
10550 
10551 /*
10552  * Internal function that runs load balance for all idle cpus. The load balance
10553  * can be a simple update of blocked load or a complete load balance with
10554  * tasks movement depending of flags.
10555  * The function returns false if the loop has stopped before running
10556  * through all idle CPUs.
10557  */
10558 static bool _nohz_idle_balance(struct rq *this_rq, unsigned int flags,
     /*   */
10559                                enum cpu_idle_type idle)
10560 {
10561         /* Earliest time when we have to do rebalance again */
10562         unsigned long now = jiffies;
10563         unsigned long next_balance = now + 60*HZ;
10564         bool has_blocked_load = false;
10565         int update_next_balance = 0;
10566         int this_cpu = this_rq->cpu;
10567         int balance_cpu;
10568         int ret = false;
10569         struct rq *rq;
10570 
10571         SCHED_WARN_ON((flags & NOHZ_KICK_MASK) == NOHZ_BALANCE_KICK);
10572 
10573         /*
10574          * We assume there will be no idle load after this update and clear
10575          * the has_blocked flag. If a cpu enters idle in the mean time, it will
10576          * set the has_blocked flag and trig another update of idle load.
10577          * Because a cpu that becomes idle, is added to idle_cpus_mask before
10578          * setting the flag, we are sure to not clear the state and not
10579          * check the load of an idle cpu.
10580          */
10581         WRITE_ONCE(nohz.has_blocked, 0);
10582 
10583         /*
10584          * Ensures that if we miss the CPU, we must see the has_blocked
10585          * store from nohz_balance_enter_idle().
10586          */
10587         smp_mb();
10588 
10589         for_each_cpu(balance_cpu, nohz.idle_cpus_mask) {
10590                 if (balance_cpu == this_cpu || !idle_cpu(balance_cpu))
10591                         continue;
10592 
10593                 /*
10594                  * If this CPU gets work to do, stop the load balancing
10595                  * work being done for other CPUs. Next load
10596                  * balancing owner will pick it up.
10597                  */
10598                 if (need_resched()) {
10599                         has_blocked_load = true;
10600                         goto abort;
10601                 }
10602 
10603                 rq = cpu_rq(balance_cpu);
10604 
10605                 has_blocked_load |= update_nohz_stats(rq, true);
10606 
10607                 /*
10608                  * If time for next balance is due,
10609                  * do the balance.
10610                  */
10611                 if (time_after_eq(jiffies, rq->next_balance)) {
10612                         struct rq_flags rf;
10613 
10614                         rq_lock_irqsave(rq, &rf);
10615                         update_rq_clock(rq);
10616                         rq_unlock_irqrestore(rq, &rf);
10617 
10618                         if (flags & NOHZ_BALANCE_KICK)
10619                                 rebalance_domains(rq, CPU_IDLE);
10620                 }
10621 
10622                 if (time_after(next_balance, rq->next_balance)) {
10623                         next_balance = rq->next_balance;
10624                         update_next_balance = 1;
10625                 }
10626         }
10627 
10628         /*
10629          * next_balance will be updated only when there is a need.
10630          * When the CPU is attached to null domain for ex, it will not be
10631          * updated.
10632          */
10633         if (likely(update_next_balance))
10634                 nohz.next_balance = next_balance;
10635 
10636         /* Newly idle CPU doesn't need an update */
10637         if (idle != CPU_NEWLY_IDLE) {
10638                 update_blocked_averages(this_cpu);
10639                 has_blocked_load |= this_rq->has_blocked_load;
10640         }
10641 
10642         if (flags & NOHZ_BALANCE_KICK)
10643                 rebalance_domains(this_rq, CPU_IDLE);
10644 
10645         WRITE_ONCE(nohz.next_blocked,
10646                 now + msecs_to_jiffies(LOAD_AVG_PERIOD));
10647 
10648         /* The full idle balance loop has been done */
10649         ret = true;
10650 
10651 abort:
10652         /* There is still blocked load, enable periodic update */
10653         if (has_blocked_load)
10654                 WRITE_ONCE(nohz.has_blocked, 1);
10655 
10656         return ret;
10657 }
10658 
10659 /*
10660  * In CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON case, the idle balance kickee will do the
10661  * rebalancing for all the cpus for whom scheduler ticks are stopped.
10662  */
10663 static bool nohz_idle_balance(struct rq *this_rq, enum cpu_idle_type idle)
     /*   */
10664 {
10665         unsigned int flags = this_rq->nohz_idle_balance;
10666 
10667         if (!flags)
10668                 return false;
10669 
10670         this_rq->nohz_idle_balance = 0;
10671 
10672         if (idle != CPU_IDLE)
10673                 return false;
10674 
10675         _nohz_idle_balance(this_rq, flags, idle);
10676 
10677         return true;
10678 }
10679 
10680 static void nohz_newidle_balance(struct rq *this_rq)
     /*   */
10681 {
10682         int this_cpu = this_rq->cpu;
10683 
10684         /*
10685          * This CPU doesn't want to be disturbed by scheduler
10686          * housekeeping
10687          */
10688         if (!housekeeping_cpu(this_cpu, HK_FLAG_SCHED))
10689                 return;
10690 
10691         /* Will wake up very soon. No time for doing anything else*/
10692         if (this_rq->avg_idle < sysctl_sched_migration_cost)
10693                 return;
10694 
10695         /* Don't need to update blocked load of idle CPUs*/
10696         if (!READ_ONCE(nohz.has_blocked) ||
10697             time_before(jiffies, READ_ONCE(nohz.next_blocked)))
10698                 return;
10699 
10700         raw_spin_unlock(&this_rq->lock);
10701         /*
10702          * This CPU is going to be idle and blocked load of idle CPUs
10703          * need to be updated. Run the ilb locally as it is a good
10704          * candidate for ilb instead of waking up another idle CPU.
10705          * Kick an normal ilb if we failed to do the update.
10706          */
10707         if (!_nohz_idle_balance(this_rq, NOHZ_STATS_KICK, CPU_NEWLY_IDLE))
10708                 kick_ilb(NOHZ_STATS_KICK);
10709         raw_spin_lock(&this_rq->lock);
10710 }
10711 
10712 #else /* !CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON */
10713 static inline void nohz_balancer_kick(struct rq *rq) { }
     /*   */
10714 
10715 static inline bool nohz_idle_balance(struct rq *this_rq, enum cpu_idle_type idle)
     /*   */
10716 {
10717         return false;
10718 }
10719 
10720 static inline void nohz_newidle_balance(struct rq *this_rq) { }
     /*   */
10721 #endif /* CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON */
10722 
10723 /*
10724  * idle_balance is called by schedule() if this_cpu is about to become
10725  * idle. Attempts to pull tasks from other CPUs.
10726  *
10727  * Returns:
10728  *   < 0 - we released the lock and there are !fair tasks present
10729  *     0 - failed, no new tasks
10730  *   > 0 - success, new (fair) tasks present
10731  */
10732 static int newidle_balance(struct rq *this_rq, struct rq_flags *rf)
     /*   */
10733 {
10734         unsigned long next_balance = jiffies + HZ;
10735         int this_cpu = this_rq->cpu;
10736         struct sched_domain *sd;
10737         int pulled_task = 0;
10738         u64 curr_cost = 0;
10739         int done = 0;
10740 
10741         trace_android_rvh_sched_newidle_balance(this_rq, rf, &pulled_task, &done);
10742         if (done)
10743                 return pulled_task;
10744 
10745         update_misfit_status(NULL, this_rq);
10746         /*
10747          * We must set idle_stamp _before_ calling idle_balance(), such that we
10748          * measure the duration of idle_balance() as idle time.
10749          */
10750         this_rq->idle_stamp = rq_clock(this_rq);
10751 
10752         /*
10753          * Do not pull tasks towards !active CPUs...
10754          */
10755         if (!cpu_active(this_cpu))
10756                 return 0;
10757 
10758         /*
10759          * This is OK, because current is on_cpu, which avoids it being picked
10760          * for load-balance and preemption/IRQs are still disabled avoiding
10761          * further scheduler activity on it and we're being very careful to
10762          * re-start the picking loop.
10763          */
10764         rq_unpin_lock(this_rq, rf);
10765 
10766         if (this_rq->avg_idle < sysctl_sched_migration_cost ||
10767             !READ_ONCE(this_rq->rd->overload)) {
10768 
10769                 rcu_read_lock();
10770                 sd = rcu_dereference_check_sched_domain(this_rq->sd);
10771                 if (sd)
10772                         update_next_balance(sd, &next_balance);
10773                 rcu_read_unlock();
10774 
10775                 nohz_newidle_balance(this_rq);
10776 
10777                 goto out;
10778         }
10779 
10780         raw_spin_unlock(&this_rq->lock);
10781 
10782         update_blocked_averages(this_cpu);
10783         rcu_read_lock();
10784         for_each_domain(this_cpu, sd) {
10785                 int continue_balancing = 1;
10786                 u64 t0, domain_cost;
10787 
10788                 if (this_rq->avg_idle < curr_cost + sd->max_newidle_lb_cost) {
10789                         update_next_balance(sd, &next_balance);
10790                         break;
10791                 }
10792 
10793                 if (sd->flags & SD_BALANCE_NEWIDLE) {
10794                         t0 = sched_clock_cpu(this_cpu);
10795 
10796                         pulled_task = load_balance(this_cpu, this_rq,
10797                                                    sd, CPU_NEWLY_IDLE,
10798                                                    &continue_balancing);
10799 
10800                         domain_cost = sched_clock_cpu(this_cpu) - t0;
10801                         if (domain_cost > sd->max_newidle_lb_cost)
10802                                 sd->max_newidle_lb_cost = domain_cost;
10803 
10804                         curr_cost += domain_cost;
10805                 }
10806 
10807                 update_next_balance(sd, &next_balance);
10808 
10809                 /*
10810                  * Stop searching for tasks to pull if there are
10811                  * now runnable tasks on this rq.
10812                  */
10813                 if (pulled_task || this_rq->nr_running > 0)
10814                         break;
10815         }
10816         rcu_read_unlock();
10817 
10818         raw_spin_lock(&this_rq->lock);
10819 
10820         if (curr_cost > this_rq->max_idle_balance_cost)
10821                 this_rq->max_idle_balance_cost = curr_cost;
10822 
10823 out:
10824         /*
10825          * While browsing the domains, we released the rq lock, a task could
10826          * have been enqueued in the meantime. Since we're not going idle,
10827          * pretend we pulled a task.
10828          */
10829         if (this_rq->cfs.h_nr_running && !pulled_task)
10830                 pulled_task = 1;
10831 
10832         /* Move the next balance forward */
10833         if (time_after(this_rq->next_balance, next_balance))
10834                 this_rq->next_balance = next_balance;
10835 
10836         /* Is there a task of a high priority class? */
10837         if (this_rq->nr_running != this_rq->cfs.h_nr_running)
10838                 pulled_task = -1;
10839 
10840         if (pulled_task)
10841                 this_rq->idle_stamp = 0;
10842 
10843         rq_repin_lock(this_rq, rf);
10844 
10845         return pulled_task;
10846 }
10847 
10848 /*
10849  * run_rebalance_domains is triggered when needed from the scheduler tick.
10850  * Also triggered for nohz idle balancing (with nohz_balancing_kick set).
10851  */
10852 static __latent_entropy void run_rebalance_domains(struct softirq_action *h)
     /*   */
10853 {
10854         struct rq *this_rq = this_rq();
10855         enum cpu_idle_type idle = this_rq->idle_balance ?
10856                                                 CPU_IDLE : CPU_NOT_IDLE;
10857 
10858         /*
10859          * If this CPU has a pending nohz_balance_kick, then do the
10860          * balancing on behalf of the other idle CPUs whose ticks are
10861          * stopped. Do nohz_idle_balance *before* rebalance_domains to
10862          * give the idle CPUs a chance to load balance. Else we may
10863          * load balance only within the local sched_domain hierarchy
10864          * and abort nohz_idle_balance altogether if we pull some load.
10865          */
10866         if (nohz_idle_balance(this_rq, idle))
10867                 return;
10868 
10869         /* normal load balance */
10870         update_blocked_averages(this_rq->cpu);
10871         rebalance_domains(this_rq, idle);
10872 }
10873 
10874 /*
10875  * Trigger the SCHED_SOFTIRQ if it is time to do periodic load balancing.
10876  */
10877 void trigger_load_balance(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
10878 {
10879         /* Don't need to rebalance while attached to NULL domain */
10880         if (unlikely(on_null_domain(rq)))
10881                 return;
10882 
10883         if (time_after_eq(jiffies, rq->next_balance))
10884                 raise_softirq(SCHED_SOFTIRQ);
10885 
10886         nohz_balancer_kick(rq);
10887 }
10888 
10889 static void rq_online_fair(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
10890 {
10891         update_sysctl();
10892 
10893         update_runtime_enabled(rq);
10894 }
10895 
10896 static void rq_offline_fair(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
10897 {
10898         update_sysctl();
10899 
10900         /* Ensure any throttled groups are reachable by pick_next_task */
10901         unthrottle_offline_cfs_rqs(rq);
10902 }
10903 
10904 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
10905 
10906 /*
10907  * scheduler tick hitting a task of our scheduling class.
10908  *
10909  * NOTE: This function can be called remotely by the tick offload that
10910  * goes along full dynticks. Therefore no local assumption can be made
10911  * and everything must be accessed through the @rq and @curr passed in
10912  * parameters.
10913  */
10914 static void task_tick_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *curr, int queued)
     /*   */
10915 {
10916         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
10917         struct sched_entity *se = &curr->se;
10918 
10919         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
10920                 cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
10921                 entity_tick(cfs_rq, se, queued);
10922         }
10923 
10924         if (static_branch_unlikely(&sched_numa_balancing))
10925                 task_tick_numa(rq, curr);
10926 
10927         update_misfit_status(curr, rq);
10928         update_overutilized_status(task_rq(curr));
10929 }
10930 
10931 /*
10932  * called on fork with the child task as argument from the parent's context
10933  *  - child not yet on the tasklist
10934  *  - preemption disabled
10935  */
10936 static void task_fork_fair(struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
10937 {
10938         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
10939         struct sched_entity *se = &p->se, *curr;
10940         struct rq *rq = this_rq();
10941         struct rq_flags rf;
10942 
10943         rq_lock(rq, &rf);
10944         update_rq_clock(rq);
10945 
10946         cfs_rq = task_cfs_rq(current);
10947         curr = cfs_rq->curr;
10948         if (curr) {
10949                 update_curr(cfs_rq);
10950                 se->vruntime = curr->vruntime;
10951         }
10952         place_entity(cfs_rq, se, 1);
10953 
10954         if (sysctl_sched_child_runs_first && curr && entity_before(curr, se)) {
10955                 /*
10956                  * Upon rescheduling, sched_class::put_prev_task() will place
10957                  * 'current' within the tree based on its new key value.
10958                  */
10959                 swap(curr->vruntime, se->vruntime);
10960                 resched_curr(rq);
10961         }
10962 
10963         se->vruntime -= cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
10964         rq_unlock(rq, &rf);
10965 }
10966 
10967 /*
10968  * Priority of the task has changed. Check to see if we preempt
10969  * the current task.
10970  */
10971 static void
10972 prio_changed_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p, int oldprio)
     /*   */
10973 {
10974         if (!task_on_rq_queued(p))
10975                 return;
10976 
10977         if (rq->cfs.nr_running == 1)
10978                 return;
10979 
10980         /*
10981          * Reschedule if we are currently running on this runqueue and
10982          * our priority decreased, or if we are not currently running on
10983          * this runqueue and our priority is higher than the current's
10984          */
10985         if (rq->curr == p) {
10986                 if (p->prio > oldprio)
10987                         resched_curr(rq);
10988         } else
10989                 check_preempt_curr(rq, p, 0);
10990 }
10991 
10992 static inline bool vruntime_normalized(struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
10993 {
10994         struct sched_entity *se = &p->se;
10995 
10996         /*
10997          * In both the TASK_ON_RQ_QUEUED and TASK_ON_RQ_MIGRATING cases,
10998          * the dequeue_entity(.flags=0) will already have normalized the
10999          * vruntime.
11000          */
11001         if (p->on_rq)
11002                 return true;
11003 
11004         /*
11005          * When !on_rq, vruntime of the task has usually NOT been normalized.
11006          * But there are some cases where it has already been normalized:
11007          *
11008          * - A forked child which is waiting for being woken up by
11009          *   wake_up_new_task().
11010          * - A task which has been woken up by try_to_wake_up() and
11011          *   waiting for actually being woken up by sched_ttwu_pending().
11012          */
11013         if (!se->sum_exec_runtime ||
11014             (p->state == TASK_WAKING && p->sched_remote_wakeup))
11015                 return true;
11016 
11017         return false;
11018 }
11019 
11020 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
11021 /*
11022  * Propagate the changes of the sched_entity across the tg tree to make it
11023  * visible to the root
11024  */
11025 static void propagate_entity_cfs_rq(struct sched_entity *se)
     /*   */
11026 {
11027         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
11028 
11029         list_add_leaf_cfs_rq(cfs_rq_of(se));
11030 
11031         /* Start to propagate at parent */
11032         se = se->parent;
11033 
11034         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
11035                 cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
11036 
11037                 if (!cfs_rq_throttled(cfs_rq)){
11038                         update_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, UPDATE_TG);
11039                         list_add_leaf_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
11040                         continue;
11041                 }
11042 
11043                 if (list_add_leaf_cfs_rq(cfs_rq))
11044                         break;
11045         }
11046 }
11047 #else
11048 static void propagate_entity_cfs_rq(struct sched_entity *se) { }
     /*   */
11049 #endif
11050 
11051 static void detach_entity_cfs_rq(struct sched_entity *se)
     /*   */
11052 {
11053         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
11054 
11055         /* Catch up with the cfs_rq and remove our load when we leave */
11056         update_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, 0);
11057         detach_entity_load_avg(cfs_rq, se);
11058         update_tg_load_avg(cfs_rq);
11059         propagate_entity_cfs_rq(se);
11060 }
11061 
11062 static void attach_entity_cfs_rq(struct sched_entity *se)
     /*   */
11063 {
11064         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
11065 
11066 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
11067         /*
11068          * Since the real-depth could have been changed (only FAIR
11069          * class maintain depth value), reset depth properly.
11070          */
11071         se->depth = se->parent ? se->parent->depth + 1 : 0;
11072 #endif
11073 
11074         /* Synchronize entity with its cfs_rq */
11075         update_load_avg(cfs_rq, se, sched_feat(ATTACH_AGE_LOAD) ? 0 : SKIP_AGE_LOAD);
11076         attach_entity_load_avg(cfs_rq, se);
11077         update_tg_load_avg(cfs_rq);
11078         propagate_entity_cfs_rq(se);
11079 }
11080 
11081 static void detach_task_cfs_rq(struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
11082 {
11083         struct sched_entity *se = &p->se;
11084         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
11085 
11086         if (!vruntime_normalized(p)) {
11087                 /*
11088                  * Fix up our vruntime so that the current sleep doesn't
11089                  * cause 'unlimited' sleep bonus.
11090                  */
11091                 place_entity(cfs_rq, se, 0);
11092                 se->vruntime -= cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
11093         }
11094 
11095         detach_entity_cfs_rq(se);
11096 }
11097 
11098 static void attach_task_cfs_rq(struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
11099 {
11100         struct sched_entity *se = &p->se;
11101         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
11102 
11103         attach_entity_cfs_rq(se);
11104 
11105         if (!vruntime_normalized(p))
11106                 se->vruntime += cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
11107 }
11108 
11109 static void switched_from_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
11110 {
11111         detach_task_cfs_rq(p);
11112 }
11113 
11114 static void switched_to_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
11115 {
11116         attach_task_cfs_rq(p);
11117 
11118         if (task_on_rq_queued(p)) {
11119                 /*
11120                  * We were most likely switched from sched_rt, so
11121                  * kick off the schedule if running, otherwise just see
11122                  * if we can still preempt the current task.
11123                  */
11124                 if (rq->curr == p)
11125                         resched_curr(rq);
11126                 else
11127                         check_preempt_curr(rq, p, 0);
11128         }
11129 }
11130 
11131 /* Account for a task changing its policy or group.
11132  *
11133  * This routine is mostly called to set cfs_rq->curr field when a task
11134  * migrates between groups/classes.
11135  */
11136 static void set_next_task_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *p, bool first)
     /*   */
11137 {
11138         struct sched_entity *se = &p->se;
11139 
11140 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
11141         if (task_on_rq_queued(p)) {
11142                 /*
11143                  * Move the next running task to the front of the list, so our
11144                  * cfs_tasks list becomes MRU one.
11145                  */
11146                 list_move(&se->group_node, &rq->cfs_tasks);
11147         }
11148 #endif
11149 
11150         for_each_sched_entity(se) {
11151                 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = cfs_rq_of(se);
11152 
11153                 set_next_entity(cfs_rq, se);
11154                 /* ensure bandwidth has been allocated on our new cfs_rq */
11155                 account_cfs_rq_runtime(cfs_rq, 0);
11156         }
11157 }
11158 
11159 void init_cfs_rq(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
11160 {
11161         cfs_rq->tasks_timeline = RB_ROOT_CACHED;
11162         cfs_rq->min_vruntime = (u64)(-(1LL << 20));
11163 #ifndef CONFIG_64BIT
11164         cfs_rq->min_vruntime_copy = cfs_rq->min_vruntime;
11165 #endif
11166 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
11167         raw_spin_lock_init(&cfs_rq->removed.lock);
11168 #endif
11169 }
11170 
11171 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
11172 static void task_set_group_fair(struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
11173 {
11174         struct sched_entity *se = &p->se;
11175 
11176         set_task_rq(p, task_cpu(p));
11177         se->depth = se->parent ? se->parent->depth + 1 : 0;
11178 }
11179 
11180 static void task_move_group_fair(struct task_struct *p)
     /*   */
11181 {
11182         detach_task_cfs_rq(p);
11183         set_task_rq(p, task_cpu(p));
11184 
11185 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
11186         /* Tell se's cfs_rq has been changed -- migrated */
11187         p->se.avg.last_update_time = 0;
11188 #endif
11189         attach_task_cfs_rq(p);
11190 }
11191 
11192 static void task_change_group_fair(struct task_struct *p, int type)
     /*   */
11193 {
11194         switch (type) {
11195         case TASK_SET_GROUP:
11196                 task_set_group_fair(p);
11197                 break;
11198 
11199         case TASK_MOVE_GROUP:
11200                 task_move_group_fair(p);
11201                 break;
11202         }
11203 }
11204 
11205 void free_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg)
     /*   */
11206 {
11207         int i;
11208 
11209         destroy_cfs_bandwidth(tg_cfs_bandwidth(tg));
11210 
11211         for_each_possible_cpu(i) {
11212                 if (tg->cfs_rq)
11213                         kfree(tg->cfs_rq[i]);
11214                 if (tg->se)
11215                         kfree(tg->se[i]);
11216         }
11217 
11218         kfree(tg->cfs_rq);
11219         kfree(tg->se);
11220 }
11221 
11222 int alloc_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg, struct task_group *parent)
     /*   */
11223 {
11224         struct sched_entity *se;
11225         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq;
11226         int i;
11227 
11228         tg->cfs_rq = kcalloc(nr_cpu_ids, sizeof(cfs_rq), GFP_KERNEL);
11229         if (!tg->cfs_rq)
11230                 goto err;
11231         tg->se = kcalloc(nr_cpu_ids, sizeof(se), GFP_KERNEL);
11232         if (!tg->se)
11233                 goto err;
11234 
11235         tg->shares = NICE_0_LOAD;
11236 
11237         init_cfs_bandwidth(tg_cfs_bandwidth(tg));
11238 
11239         for_each_possible_cpu(i) {
11240                 cfs_rq = kzalloc_node(sizeof(struct cfs_rq),
11241                                       GFP_KERNEL, cpu_to_node(i));
11242                 if (!cfs_rq)
11243                         goto err;
11244 
11245                 se = kzalloc_node(sizeof(struct sched_entity),
11246                                   GFP_KERNEL, cpu_to_node(i));
11247                 if (!se)
11248                         goto err_free_rq;
11249 
11250                 init_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
11251                 init_tg_cfs_entry(tg, cfs_rq, se, i, parent->se[i]);
11252                 init_entity_runnable_average(se);
11253         }
11254 
11255         return 1;
11256 
11257 err_free_rq:
11258         kfree(cfs_rq);
11259 err:
11260         return 0;
11261 }
11262 
11263 void online_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg)
     /*   */
11264 {
11265         struct sched_entity *se;
11266         struct rq_flags rf;
11267         struct rq *rq;
11268         int i;
11269 
11270         for_each_possible_cpu(i) {
11271                 rq = cpu_rq(i);
11272                 se = tg->se[i];
11273                 rq_lock_irq(rq, &rf);
11274                 update_rq_clock(rq);
11275                 attach_entity_cfs_rq(se);
11276                 sync_throttle(tg, i);
11277                 rq_unlock_irq(rq, &rf);
11278         }
11279 }
11280 
11281 void unregister_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg)
     /*   */
11282 {
11283         unsigned long flags;
11284         struct rq *rq;
11285         int cpu;
11286 
11287         for_each_possible_cpu(cpu) {
11288                 if (tg->se[cpu])
11289                         remove_entity_load_avg(tg->se[cpu]);
11290 
11291                 /*
11292                  * Only empty task groups can be destroyed; so we can speculatively
11293                  * check on_list without danger of it being re-added.
11294                  */
11295                 if (!tg->cfs_rq[cpu]->on_list)
11296                         continue;
11297 
11298                 rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
11299 
11300                 raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&rq->lock, flags);
11301                 list_del_leaf_cfs_rq(tg->cfs_rq[cpu]);
11302                 raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&rq->lock, flags);
11303         }
11304 }
11305 
11306 void init_tg_cfs_entry(struct task_group *tg, struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq,
     /*   */
11307                         struct sched_entity *se, int cpu,
11308                         struct sched_entity *parent)
11309 {
11310         struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
11311 
11312         cfs_rq->tg = tg;
11313         cfs_rq->rq = rq;
11314         init_cfs_rq_runtime(cfs_rq);
11315 
11316         tg->cfs_rq[cpu] = cfs_rq;
11317         tg->se[cpu] = se;
11318 
11319         /* se could be NULL for root_task_group */
11320         if (!se)
11321                 return;
11322 
11323         if (!parent) {
11324                 se->cfs_rq = &rq->cfs;
11325                 se->depth = 0;
11326         } else {
11327                 se->cfs_rq = parent->my_q;
11328                 se->depth = parent->depth + 1;
11329         }
11330 
11331         se->my_q = cfs_rq;
11332         /* guarantee group entities always have weight */
11333         update_load_set(&se->load, NICE_0_LOAD);
11334         se->parent = parent;
11335 }
11336 
11337 static DEFINE_MUTEX(shares_mutex);
11338 
11339 int sched_group_set_shares(struct task_group *tg, unsigned long shares)
     /*   */
11340 {
11341         int i;
11342 
11343         /*
11344          * We can't change the weight of the root cgroup.
11345          */
11346         if (!tg->se[0])
11347                 return -EINVAL;
11348 
11349         shares = clamp(shares, scale_load(MIN_SHARES), scale_load(MAX_SHARES));
11350 
11351         mutex_lock(&shares_mutex);
11352         if (tg->shares == shares)
11353                 goto done;
11354 
11355         tg->shares = shares;
11356         for_each_possible_cpu(i) {
11357                 struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(i);
11358                 struct sched_entity *se = tg->se[i];
11359                 struct rq_flags rf;
11360 
11361                 /* Propagate contribution to hierarchy */
11362                 rq_lock_irqsave(rq, &rf);
11363                 update_rq_clock(rq);
11364                 for_each_sched_entity(se) {
11365                         update_load_avg(cfs_rq_of(se), se, UPDATE_TG);
11366                         update_cfs_group(se);
11367                 }
11368                 rq_unlock_irqrestore(rq, &rf);
11369         }
11370 
11371 done:
11372         mutex_unlock(&shares_mutex);
11373         return 0;
11374 }
11375 #else /* CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED */
11376 
11377 void free_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg) { }
     /*   */
11378 
11379 int alloc_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg, struct task_group *parent)
     /*   */
11380 {
11381         return 1;
11382 }
11383 
11384 void online_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg) { }
     /*   */
11385 
11386 void unregister_fair_sched_group(struct task_group *tg) { }
     /*   */
11387 
11388 #endif /* CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED */
11389 
11390 
11391 static unsigned int get_rr_interval_fair(struct rq *rq, struct task_struct *task)
     /*   */
11392 {
11393         struct sched_entity *se = &task->se;
11394         unsigned int rr_interval = 0;
11395 
11396         /*
11397          * Time slice is 0 for SCHED_OTHER tasks that are on an otherwise
11398          * idle runqueue:
11399          */
11400         if (rq->cfs.load.weight)
11401                 rr_interval = NS_TO_JIFFIES(sched_slice(cfs_rq_of(se), se));
11402 
11403         return rr_interval;
11404 }
11405 
11406 /*
11407  * All the scheduling class methods:
11408  */
11409 const struct sched_class fair_sched_class
11410         __section("__fair_sched_class") = {
11411         .enqueue_task           = enqueue_task_fair,
11412         .dequeue_task           = dequeue_task_fair,
11413         .yield_task             = yield_task_fair,
11414         .yield_to_task          = yield_to_task_fair,
11415 
11416         .check_preempt_curr     = check_preempt_wakeup,
11417 
11418         .pick_next_task         = __pick_next_task_fair,
11419         .put_prev_task          = put_prev_task_fair,
11420         .set_next_task          = set_next_task_fair,
11421 
11422 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
11423         .balance                = balance_fair,
11424         .select_task_rq         = select_task_rq_fair,
11425         .migrate_task_rq        = migrate_task_rq_fair,
11426 
11427         .rq_online              = rq_online_fair,
11428         .rq_offline             = rq_offline_fair,
11429 
11430         .task_dead              = task_dead_fair,
11431         .set_cpus_allowed       = set_cpus_allowed_common,
11432 #endif
11433 
11434         .task_tick              = task_tick_fair,
11435         .task_fork              = task_fork_fair,
11436 
11437         .prio_changed           = prio_changed_fair,
11438         .switched_from          = switched_from_fair,
11439         .switched_to            = switched_to_fair,
11440 
11441         .get_rr_interval        = get_rr_interval_fair,
11442 
11443         .update_curr            = update_curr_fair,
11444 
11445 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
11446         .task_change_group      = task_change_group_fair,
11447 #endif
11448 
11449 #ifdef CONFIG_UCLAMP_TASK
11450         .uclamp_enabled         = 1,
11451 #endif
11452 };
11453 
11454 #ifdef CONFIG_SCHED_DEBUG
11455 void print_cfs_stats(struct seq_file *m, int cpu)
     /*   */
11456 {
11457         struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, *pos;
11458 
11459         rcu_read_lock();
11460         for_each_leaf_cfs_rq_safe(cpu_rq(cpu), cfs_rq, pos)
11461                 print_cfs_rq(m, cpu, cfs_rq);
11462         rcu_read_unlock();
11463 }
11464 
11465 #ifdef CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING
11466 void show_numa_stats(struct task_struct *p, struct seq_file *m)
     /*   */
11467 {
11468         int node;
11469         unsigned long tsf = 0, tpf = 0, gsf = 0, gpf = 0;
11470         struct numa_group *ng;
11471 
11472         rcu_read_lock();
11473         ng = rcu_dereference(p->numa_group);
11474         for_each_online_node(node) {
11475                 if (p->numa_faults) {
11476                         tsf = p->numa_faults[task_faults_idx(NUMA_MEM, node, 0)];
11477                         tpf = p->numa_faults[task_faults_idx(NUMA_MEM, node, 1)];
11478                 }
11479                 if (ng) {
11480                         gsf = ng->faults[task_faults_idx(NUMA_MEM, node, 0)],
11481                         gpf = ng->faults[task_faults_idx(NUMA_MEM, node, 1)];
11482                 }
11483                 print_numa_stats(m, node, tsf, tpf, gsf, gpf);
11484         }
11485         rcu_read_unlock();
11486 }
11487 #endif /* CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING */
11488 #endif /* CONFIG_SCHED_DEBUG */
11489 
11490 __init void init_sched_fair_class(void)
     /*   */
11491 {
11492 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
11493         open_softirq(SCHED_SOFTIRQ, run_rebalance_domains);
11494 
11495 #ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
11496         nohz.next_balance = jiffies;
11497         nohz.next_blocked = jiffies;
11498         zalloc_cpumask_var(&nohz.idle_cpus_mask, GFP_NOWAIT);
11499 #endif
11500 #endif /* SMP */
11501 
11502 }
11503 
11504 /*
11505  * Helper functions to facilitate extracting info from tracepoints.
11506  */
11507 
11508 const struct sched_avg *sched_trace_cfs_rq_avg(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
11509 {
11510 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
11511         return cfs_rq ? &cfs_rq->avg : NULL;
11512 #else
11513         return NULL;
11514 #endif
11515 }
11516 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(sched_trace_cfs_rq_avg);
11517 
11518 char *sched_trace_cfs_rq_path(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq, char *str, int len)
     /*   */
11519 {
11520         if (!cfs_rq) {
11521                 if (str)
11522                         strlcpy(str, "(null)", len);
11523                 else
11524                         return NULL;
11525         }
11526 
11527         cfs_rq_tg_path(cfs_rq, str, len);
11528         return str;
11529 }
11530 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(sched_trace_cfs_rq_path);
11531 
11532 int sched_trace_cfs_rq_cpu(struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq)
     /*   */
11533 {
11534         return cfs_rq ? cpu_of(rq_of(cfs_rq)) : -1;
11535 }
11536 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(sched_trace_cfs_rq_cpu);
11537 
11538 const struct sched_avg *sched_trace_rq_avg_rt(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
11539 {
11540 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
11541         return rq ? &rq->avg_rt : NULL;
11542 #else
11543         return NULL;
11544 #endif
11545 }
11546 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(sched_trace_rq_avg_rt);
11547 
11548 const struct sched_avg *sched_trace_rq_avg_dl(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
11549 {
11550 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
11551         return rq ? &rq->avg_dl : NULL;
11552 #else
11553         return NULL;
11554 #endif
11555 }
11556 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(sched_trace_rq_avg_dl);
11557 
11558 const struct sched_avg *sched_trace_rq_avg_irq(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
11559 {
11560 #if defined(CONFIG_SMP) && defined(CONFIG_HAVE_SCHED_AVG_IRQ)
11561         return rq ? &rq->avg_irq : NULL;
11562 #else
11563         return NULL;
11564 #endif
11565 }
11566 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(sched_trace_rq_avg_irq);
11567 
11568 int sched_trace_rq_cpu(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
11569 {
11570         return rq ? cpu_of(rq) : -1;
11571 }
11572 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(sched_trace_rq_cpu);
11573 
11574 int sched_trace_rq_cpu_capacity(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
11575 {
11576         return rq ?
11577 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
11578                 rq->cpu_capacity
11579 #else
11580                 SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE
11581 #endif
11582                 : -1;
11583 }
11584 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(sched_trace_rq_cpu_capacity);
11585 
11586 const struct cpumask *sched_trace_rd_span(struct root_domain *rd)
     /*   */
11587 {
11588 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
11589         return rd ? rd->span : NULL;
11590 #else
11591         return NULL;
11592 #endif
11593 }
11594 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(sched_trace_rd_span);
11595 
11596 int sched_trace_rq_nr_running(struct rq *rq)
     /*   */
11597 {
11598         return rq ? rq->nr_running : -1;
11599 }
11600 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(sched_trace_rq_nr_running);
/*   */
